name: 2 Chronicles 36:18
text: All the vessels of the house of God, great and small, and the treasures of the house of Yahweh, and the treasures of the king, and of his princes, all these he brought to Babylon.

name: 2 Chronicles 36:19
text: They burnt the house of God, and broke down the wall of Jerusalem, and burnt all its palaces with fire, and destroyed all the goodly vessels of it.

name: 2 Chronicles 36:20
text: He carried those who had escaped from the sword away to Babylon; and they were servants to him and his sons until the reign of the kingdom of Persia:

name: 2 Chronicles 36:21
text: to fulfill the word of Yahweh by the mouth of Jeremiah, until the land had enjoyed its Sabbaths. As long as it lay desolate it kept Sabbath, to fulfill seventy years.

name: 2 Chronicles 36:22
text: Now in the first year of Cyrus king of Persia, that the word of Yahweh by the mouth of Jeremiah might be accomplished, Yahweh stirred up the spirit of Cyrus king of Persia, so that he made a proclamation throughout all his kingdom, and put it also in writing, saying,

name: 2 Chronicles 36:23
text: "Thus says Cyrus king of Persia, "Yahweh, the God of heaven, has given all the kingdoms of the earth to me; and he has commanded me to build him a house in Jerusalem, which is in Judah. Whoever there is among you of all his people, Yahweh his God be with him, and let him go up.""

name: Ezra 1:1
text: Now in the first year of Cyrus king of Persia, that the word of Yahweh by the mouth of Jeremiah might be accomplished, Yahweh stirred up the spirit of Cyrus king of Persia, so that he made a proclamation throughout all his kingdom, and put it also in writing, saying,

name: Ezra 1:2
text: "Thus says Cyrus king of Persia, "Yahweh, the God of heaven, has given me all the kingdoms of the earth; and he has commanded me to build him a house in Jerusalem, which is in Judah.

name: Ezra 1:3
text: Whoever there is among you of all his people, may his God be with him, and let him go up to Jerusalem, which is in Judah, and build the house of Yahweh, the God of Israel (he is God), which is in Jerusalem.

name: Ezra 1:4
text: Whoever is left, in any place where he lives, let the men of his place help him with silver, with gold, with goods, and with animals, besides the freewill offering for the house of God which is in Jerusalem.""

name: Ezra 1:5
text: Then the heads of fathers" households of Judah and Benjamin, and the priests, and the Levites, even all whose spirit God had stirred to go up rose up to build the house of Yahweh which is in Jerusalem.

name: Ezra 1:6
text: All those who were around them strengthened their hands with vessels of silver, with gold, with goods, and with animals, and with precious things, besides all that was willingly offered.

name: Ezra 1:7
text: Also Cyrus the king brought forth the vessels of the house of Yahweh, which Nebuchadnezzar had brought out of Jerusalem, and had put in the house of his gods;

name: Ezra 1:8
text: even those, Cyrus king of Persia brought out by the hand of Mithredath the treasurer, and numbered them to Sheshbazzar, the prince of Judah.

name: Ezra 1:9
text: This is the number of them: thirty platters of gold, one thousand platters of silver, twenty-nine knives,

name: Ezra 1:10
text: thirty bowls of gold, silver bowls of a second sort four hundred and ten, and other vessels one thousand.

name: Ezra 1:11
text: All the vessels of gold and of silver were five thousand and four hundred. Sheshbazzar brought all these up, when the captives were brought up from Babylon to Jerusalem.

name: Ezra 2:1
text: Now these are the children of the province, who went up out of the captivity of those who had been carried away, whom Nebuchadnezzar the king of Babylon had carried away to Babylon, and who returned to Jerusalem and Judah, everyone to his city;

name: Ezra 2:2
text: who came with Zerubbabel, Jeshua, Nehemiah, Seraiah, Reelaiah, Mordecai, Bilshan, Mispar, Bigvai, Rehum, Baanah. The number of the men of the people of Israel:

name: Ezra 2:3
text: The children of Parosh, two thousand one hundred seventy-two.

name: Ezra 2:4
text: The children of Shephatiah, three hundred seventy-two.

name: Ezra 2:5
text: The children of Arah, seven hundred seventy-five.

name: Ezra 2:6
text: The children of Pahathmoab, of the children of Jeshua and Joab, two thousand eight hundred twelve.

name: Ezra 2:7
text: The children of Elam, one thousand two hundred fifty-four.

name: Ezra 2:8
text: The children of Zattu, nine hundred forty-five.

name: Ezra 2:9
text: The children of Zaccai, seven hundred sixty.

name: Ezra 2:10
text: The children of Bani, six hundred forty-two.

name: Ezra 2:11
text: The children of Bebai, six hundred twenty-three.

name: Ezra 2:12
text: The children of Azgad, one thousand two hundred twenty-two.

name: Ezra 2:13
text: The children of Adonikam, six hundred sixty-six.

name: Ezra 2:14
text: The children of Bigvai, two thousand fifty-six.

name: Ezra 2:15
text: The children of Adin, four hundred fifty-four.

name: Ezra 2:16
text: The children of Ater, of Hezekiah, ninety-eight.

name: Ezra 2:17
text: The children of Bezai, three hundred twenty-three.

name: Ezra 2:18
text: The children of Jorah, one hundred twelve.

name: Ezra 2:19
text: The children of Hashum, two hundred twenty-three.

name: Ezra 2:20
text: The children of Gibbar, ninety-five.

name: Ezra 2:21
text: The children of Bethlehem, one hundred twenty-three.

name: Ezra 2:22
text: The men of Netophah, fifty-six.

name: Ezra 2:23
text: The men of Anathoth, one hundred twenty-eight.

name: Ezra 2:24
text: The children of Azmaveth, forty-two.

name: Ezra 2:25
text: The children of Kiriath Arim, Chephirah, and Beeroth, seven hundred forty-three.

name: Ezra 2:26
text: The children of Ramah and Geba, six hundred twenty-one.

name: Ezra 2:27
text: The men of Michmas, one hundred twenty-two.

name: Ezra 2:28
text: The men of Bethel and Ai, two hundred twenty-three.

name: Ezra 2:29
text: The children of Nebo, fifty-two.

name: Ezra 2:30
text: The children of Magbish, one hundred fifty-six.

name: Ezra 2:31
text: The children of the other Elam, one thousand two hundred fifty-four.

name: Ezra 2:32
text: The children of Harim, three hundred twenty.

name: Ezra 2:33
text: The children of Lod, Hadid, and Ono, seven hundred twenty-five.

name: Ezra 2:34
text: The children of Jericho, three hundred forty-five.

name: Ezra 2:35
text: The children of Senaah, three thousand six hundred thirty.

name: Ezra 2:36
text: The priests: the children of Jedaiah, of the house of Jeshua, nine hundred seventy-three.

name: Ezra 2:37
text: The children of Immer, one thousand fifty-two.

name: Ezra 2:38
text: The children of Pashhur, one thousand two hundred forty-seven.

name: Ezra 2:39
text: The children of Harim, one thousand seventeen.

name: Ezra 2:40
text: The Levites: the children of Jeshua and Kadmiel, of the children of Hodaviah, seventy-four.

name: Ezra 2:41
text: The singers: the children of Asaph, one hundred twenty-eight.

name: Ezra 2:42
text: The children of the porters: the children of Shallum, the children of Ater, the children of Talmon, the children of Akkub, the children of Hatita, the children of Shobai, in all one hundred thirty-nine.

name: Ezra 2:43
text: The Nethinim: the children of Ziha, the children of Hasupha, the children of Tabbaoth,

name: Ezra 2:44
text: the children of Keros, the children of Siaha, the children of Padon,

name: Ezra 2:45
text: the children of Lebanah, the children of Hagabah, the children of Akkub,

name: Ezra 2:46
text: the children of Hagab, the children of Shamlai, the children of Hanan,

name: Ezra 2:47
text: the children of Giddel, the children of Gahar, the children of Reaiah,

name: Ezra 2:48
text: the children of Rezin, the children of Nekoda, the children of Gazzam,

name: Ezra 2:49
text: the children of Uzza, the children of Paseah, the children of Besai,

name: Ezra 2:50
text: the children of Asnah, the children of Meunim, the children of Nephisim,

name: Ezra 2:51
text: the children of Bakbuk, the children of Hakupha, the children of Harhur,

name: Ezra 2:52
text: the children of Bazluth, the children of Mehida, the children of Harsha,

name: Ezra 2:53
text: the children of Barkos, the children of Sisera, the children of Temah,

name: Ezra 2:54
text: the children of Neziah, the children of Hatipha.

name: Ezra 2:55
text: The children of Solomon"s servants: the children of Sotai, the children of Hassophereth, the children of Peruda,

name: Ezra 2:56
text: the children of Jaalah, the children of Darkon, the children of Giddel,

name: Ezra 2:57
text: the children of Shephatiah, the children of Hattil, the children of Pochereth Hazzebaim, the children of Ami.

name: Ezra 2:58
text: All the Nethinim, and the children of Solomon"s servants, were three hundred ninety-two.

name: Ezra 2:59
text: These were those who went up from Tel Melah, Tel Harsha, Cherub, Addan, and Immer; but they could not show their fathers" houses, and their seed, whether they were of Israel:

name: Ezra 2:60
text: the children of Delaiah, the children of Tobiah, the children of Nekoda, six hundred fifty-two.

name: Ezra 2:61
text: Of the children of the priests: the children of Habaiah, the children of Hakkoz, the children of Barzillai, who took a wife of the daughters of Barzillai the Gileadite, and was called after their name.

name: Ezra 2:62
text: These sought their place among those who were registered by genealogy, but they were not found: therefore were they deemed polluted and put from the priesthood.

name: Ezra 2:63
text: The governor said to them, that they should not eat of the most holy things, until there stood up a priest with Urim and with Thummim.

name: Ezra 2:64
text: The whole assembly together was forty-two thousand three hundred sixty,

name: Ezra 2:65
text: besides their male servants and their female servants, of whom there were seven thousand three hundred thirty-seven: and they had two hundred singing men and singing women.

name: Ezra 2:66
text: Their horses were seven hundred thirty-six; their mules, two hundred forty-five;

name: Ezra 2:67
text: their camels, four hundred thirty-five; their donkeys, six thousand seven hundred and twenty.

name: Ezra 2:68
text: Some of the heads of fathers" households, when they came to the house of Yahweh which is in Jerusalem, offered willingly for the house of God to set it up in its place:

name: Ezra 2:69
text: they gave after their ability into the treasury of the work sixty-one thousand darics of gold, and five thousand minas of silver, and one hundred priests" garments.

name: Ezra 2:70
text: So the priests, and the Levites, and some of the people, and the singers, and the porters, and the Nethinim, lived in their cities, and all Israel in their cities.

name: Ezra 3:1
text: When the seventh month had come, and the children of Israel were in the cities, the people gathered themselves together as one man to Jerusalem.

name: Ezra 3:2
text: Then stood up Jeshua the son of Jozadak, and his brothers the priests, and Zerubbabel the son of Shealtiel, and his brothers, and built the altar of the God of Israel, to offer burnt offerings thereon, as it is written in the law of Moses the man of God.

name: Ezra 3:3
text: They set the altar on its base; for fear was on them because of the peoples of the countries: and they offered burnt offerings thereon to Yahweh, even burnt offerings morning and evening.

name: Ezra 3:4
text: They kept the feast of tents, as it is written, and offered the daily burnt offerings by number, according to the ordinance, as the duty of every day required;

name: Ezra 3:5
text: and afterward the continual burnt offering, and the offerings of the new moons, and of all the set feasts of Yahweh that were consecrated, and of everyone who willingly offered a freewill offering to Yahweh.

name: Ezra 3:6
text: From the first day of the seventh month began they to offer burnt offerings to Yahweh: but the foundation of the temple of Yahweh was not yet laid.

name: Ezra 3:7
text: They gave money also to the masons, and to the carpenters; and food, and drink, and oil, to them of Sidon, and to them of Tyre, to bring cedar trees from Lebanon to the sea, to Joppa, according to the grant that they had of Cyrus king of Persia.

name: Ezra 3:8
text: Now in the second year of their coming to the house of God at Jerusalem, in the second month, began Zerubbabel the son of Shealtiel, and Jeshua the son of Jozadak, and the rest of their brothers the priests and the Levites, and all those who were come out of the captivity to Jerusalem, and appointed the Levites, from twenty years old and upward, to have the oversight of the work of the house of Yahweh.

name: Ezra 3:9
text: Then stood Jeshua with his sons and his brothers, Kadmiel and his sons, the sons of Judah, together, to have the oversight of the workmen in the house of God: the sons of Henadad, with their sons and their brothers the Levites.

name: Ezra 3:10
text: When the builders laid the foundation of the temple of Yahweh, they set the priests in their clothing with trumpets, and the Levites the sons of Asaph with cymbals, to praise Yahweh, after the order of David king of Israel.

name: Ezra 3:11
text: They sang one to another in praising and giving thanks to Yahweh, "For he is good, for his loving kindness endures forever toward Israel." All the people shouted with a great shout, when they praised Yahweh, because the foundation of the house of Yahweh was laid.

name: Ezra 3:12
text: But many of the priests and Levites and heads of fathers" households, the old men who had seen the first house, when the foundation of this house was laid before their eyes, wept with a loud voice; and many shouted aloud for joy:

name: Ezra 3:13
text: so that the people could not discern the noise of the shout of joy from the noise of the weeping of the people; for the people shouted with a loud shout, and the noise was heard afar off.

name: Ezra 4:1
text: Now when the adversaries of Judah and Benjamin heard that the children of the captivity were building a temple to Yahweh, the God of Israel;

name: Ezra 4:2
text: then they drew near to Zerubbabel, and to the heads of fathers" households, and said to them, "Let us build with you; for we seek your God, as you do; and we sacrifice to him since the days of Esar Haddon king of Assyria, who brought us up here."

name: Ezra 4:3
text: But Zerubbabel, and Jeshua, and the rest of the heads of fathers" households of Israel, said to them, "You have nothing to do with us in building a house to our God; but we ourselves together will build to Yahweh, the God of Israel, as king Cyrus the king of Persia has commanded us."

name: Ezra 4:4
text: Then the people of the land weakened the hands of the people of Judah, and troubled them in building,

name: Ezra 4:5
text: and hired counselors against them, to frustrate their purpose, all the days of Cyrus king of Persia, even until the reign of Darius king of Persia.

name: Ezra 4:6
text: In the reign of Ahasuerus, in the beginning of his reign, wrote they an accusation against the inhabitants of Judah and Jerusalem.

name: Ezra 4:7
text: In the days of Artaxerxes wrote Bishlam, Mithredath, Tabeel, and the rest of his companions, to Artaxerxes king of Persia; and the writing of the letter was written in Syrian, and set forth in the Syrian language.

name: Ezra 4:8
text: Rehum the chancellor and Shimshai the scribe wrote a letter against Jerusalem to Artaxerxes the king in this sort:

name: Ezra 4:9
text: then Rehum the chancellor, and Shimshai the scribe, and the rest of their companions, the Dinaites, and the Apharsathchites, the Tarpelites, the Apharsites, the Archevites, the Babylonians, the Shushanchites, the Dehaites, the Elamites,

name: Ezra 4:10
text: and the rest of the nations whom the great and noble Osnappar brought over, and set in the city of Samaria, and in the rest of the country beyond the River, and so forth, wrote.

name: Ezra 4:11
text: This is the copy of the letter that they sent to Artaxerxes the king: Your servants the men beyond the River, and so forth.

name: Ezra 4:12
text: Be it known to the king, that the Jews who came up from you have come to us to Jerusalem; they are building the rebellious and the bad city, and have finished the walls, and repaired the foundations.

name: Ezra 4:13
text: Be it known now to the king that if this city is built, and the walls finished, they will not pay tribute, custom, or toll, and in the end it will be hurtful to the kings.

name: Ezra 4:14
text: Now because we eat the salt of the palace, and it is not appropriate for us to see the king"s dishonor, therefore have we sent and informed the king;

name: Ezra 4:15
text: that search may be made in the book of the records of your fathers: so you shall find in the book of the records, and know that this city is a rebellious city, and hurtful to kings and provinces, and that they have moved sedition within the same of old time; for which cause was this city laid waste.

name: Ezra 4:16
text: We inform the king that, if this city be built, and the walls finished, by this means you shall have no portion beyond the River.

name: Ezra 4:17
text: Then the king sent an answer to Rehum the chancellor, and to Shimshai the scribe, and to the rest of their companions who dwell in Samaria, and in the rest of the country beyond the River: Peace, and so forth.

name: Ezra 4:18
text: The letter which you sent to us has been plainly read before me.

name: Ezra 4:19
text: I decreed, and search has been made, and it is found that this city of old time has made insurrection against kings, and that rebellion and sedition have been made therein.

name: Ezra 4:20
text: There have been mighty kings also over Jerusalem, who have ruled over all the country beyond the River; and tribute, custom, and toll, was paid to them.

name: Ezra 4:21
text: Make a decree now to cause these men to cease, and that this city not be built, until a decree shall be made by me.

name: Ezra 4:22
text: Take heed that you not be slack herein: why should damage grow to the hurt of the kings?

name: Ezra 4:23
text: Then when the copy of king Artaxerxes" letter was read before Rehum, and Shimshai the scribe, and their companions, they went in haste to Jerusalem to the Jews, and made them to cease by force and power.

name: Ezra 4:24
text: Then ceased the work of the house of God which is at Jerusalem; and it ceased until the second year of the reign of Darius king of Persia.

name: Ezra 5:1
text: Now the prophets, Haggai the prophet, and Zechariah the son of Iddo, prophesied to the Jews who were in Judah and Jerusalem; in the name of the God of Israel they prophesied to them.

name: Ezra 5:2
text: Then rose up Zerubbabel the son of Shealtiel, and Jeshua the son of Jozadak, and began to build the house of God which is at Jerusalem; and with them were the prophets of God, helping them.

name: Ezra 5:3
text: At the same time came to them Tattenai, the governor beyond the River, and Shetharbozenai, and their companions, and said thus to them, "Who gave you a decree to build this house, and to finish this wall?"

name: Ezra 5:4
text: Then we told them in this way, what the names of the men were who were making this building.

name: Ezra 5:5
text: But the eye of their God was on the elders of the Jews, and they did not make them cease, until the matter should come to Darius, and then answer should be returned by letter concerning it.

name: Ezra 5:6
text: The copy of the letter that Tattenai, the governor beyond the River, and Shetharbozenai, and his companions the Apharsachites, who were beyond the River, sent to Darius the king;

name: Ezra 5:7
text: they sent a letter to him, in which was written thus: To Darius the king, all peace.

name: Ezra 5:8
text: Be it known to the king, that we went into the province of Judah, to the house of the great God, which is built with great stones, and timber is laid in the walls; and this work goes on with diligence and prospers in their hands.

name: Ezra 5:9
text: Then we asked those elders, and said to them thus, "Who gave you a decree to build this house, and to finish this wall?"

name: Ezra 5:10
text: We asked them their names also, to inform you that we might write the names of the men who were at their head.

name: Ezra 5:11
text: Thus they returned us answer, saying, "We are the servants of the God of heaven and earth, and are building the house that was built these many years ago, which a great king of Israel built and finished.

name: Ezra 5:12
text: But after that our fathers had provoked the God of heaven to wrath, he gave them into the hand of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, the Chaldean, who destroyed this house, and carried the people away into Babylon.

name: Ezra 5:13
text: But in the first year of Cyrus king of Babylon, Cyrus the king made a decree to build this house of God.

name: Ezra 5:14
text: The gold and silver vessels also of the house of God, which Nebuchadnezzar took out of the temple that was in Jerusalem, and brought into the temple of Babylon, those Cyrus the king took out of the temple of Babylon, and they were delivered to one whose name was Sheshbazzar, whom he had made governor;

name: Ezra 5:15
text: and he said to him, "Take these vessels, go, put them in the temple that is in Jerusalem, and let the house of God be built in its place."

name: Ezra 5:16
text: Then the same Sheshbazzar came, and laid the foundations of the house of God which is in Jerusalem: and since that time even until now has it been in building, and yet it is not completed.

name: Ezra 5:17
text: Now therefore, if it seem good to the king, let a search be made in the king"s treasure house, which is there at Babylon, whether it be so, that a decree was made of Cyrus the king to build this house of God at Jerusalem; and let the king send his pleasure to us concerning this matter."

name: Ezra 6:1
text: Then Darius the king made a decree, and search was made in the house of the archives, where the treasures were laid up in Babylon.

name: Ezra 6:2
text: There was found at Achmetha, in the palace that is in the province of Media, a scroll, and therein was thus written for a record:

name: Ezra 6:3
text: In the first year of Cyrus the king, Cyrus the king made a decree: Concerning the house of God at Jerusalem, let the house be built, the place where they offer sacrifices, and let its foundations be strongly laid; its height sixty cubits, and its breadth sixty cubits;

name: Ezra 6:4
text: with three courses of great stones, and a course of new timber: and let the expenses be given out of the king"s house.

name: Ezra 6:5
text: Also let the gold and silver vessels of the house of God, which Nebuchadnezzar took forth out of the temple which is at Jerusalem, and brought to Babylon, be restored, and brought again to the temple which is at Jerusalem, everyone to its place; and you shall put them in the house of God.

name: Ezra 6:6
text: Now therefore, Tattenai, governor beyond the River, Shetharbozenai, and your companions the Apharsachites, who are beyond the River, you must stay far from there.

name: Ezra 6:7
text: Leave the work of this house of God alone; let the governor of the Jews and the elders of the Jews build this house of God in its place.

name: Ezra 6:8
text: Moreover I make a decree what you shall do to these elders of the Jews for the building of this house of God: that of the king"s goods, even of the tribute beyond the River, expenses be given with all diligence to these men, that they be not hindered.

name: Ezra 6:9
text: That which they have need of, both young bulls, and rams, and lambs, for burnt offerings to the God of heaven; also wheat, salt, wine, and oil, according to the word of the priests who are at Jerusalem, let it be given them day by day without fail;

name: Ezra 6:10
text: that they may offer sacrifices of pleasant aroma to the God of heaven, and pray for the life of the king, and of his sons.

name: Ezra 6:11
text: Also I have made a decree, that whoever shall alter this word, let a beam be pulled out from his house, and let him be lifted up and fastened thereon; and let his house be made a dunghill for this:

name: Ezra 6:12
text: and the God who has caused his name to dwell there overthrow all kings and peoples who shall put forth their hand to alter the same, to destroy this house of God which is at Jerusalem. I Darius have made a decree; let it be done with all diligence.

name: Ezra 6:13
text: Then Tattenai, the governor beyond the River, Shetharbozenai, and their companions, because Darius the king had sent a decree, did accordingly with all diligence.

name: Ezra 6:14
text: The elders of the Jews built and prospered, through the prophesying of Haggai the prophet and Zechariah the son of Iddo. They built and finished it, according to the commandment of the God of Israel, and according to the decree of Cyrus, and Darius, and Artaxerxes king of Persia.

name: Ezra 6:15
text: This house was finished on the third day of the month Adar, which was in the sixth year of the reign of Darius the king.

name: Ezra 6:16
text: The children of Israel, the priests, and the Levites, and the rest of the children of the captivity, kept the dedication of this house of God with joy.

name: Ezra 6:17
text: They offered at the dedication of this house of God one hundred bulls, two hundred rams, four hundred lambs; and for a sin offering for all Israel, twelve male goats, according to the number of the tribes of Israel.

name: Ezra 6:18
text: They set the priests in their divisions, and the Levites in their courses, for the service of God, which is at Jerusalem; as it is written in the book of Moses.

name: Ezra 6:19
text: The children of the captivity kept the Passover on the fourteenth day of the first month.

name: Ezra 6:20
text: For the priests and the Levites had purified themselves together; all of them were pure: and they killed the Passover for all the children of the captivity, and for their brothers the priests, and for themselves.

name: Ezra 6:21
text: The children of Israel who had come again out of the captivity, and all such as had separated themselves to them from the filthiness of the nations of the land, to seek Yahweh, the God of Israel, ate,

name: Ezra 6:22
text: and kept the feast of unleavened bread seven days with joy: for Yahweh had made them joyful, and had turned the heart of the king of Assyria to them, to strengthen their hands in the work of the house of God, the God of Israel.

name: Ezra 7:1
text: Now after these things, in the reign of Artaxerxes king of Persia, Ezra the son of Seraiah, the son of Azariah, the son of Hilkiah,

name: Ezra 7:2
text: the son of Shallum, the son of Zadok, the son of Ahitub,

name: Ezra 7:3
text: the son of Amariah, the son of Azariah, the son of Meraioth,

name: Ezra 7:4
text: the son of Zerahiah, the son of Uzzi, the son of Bukki,

name: Ezra 7:5
text: the son of Abishua, the son of Phinehas, the son of Eleazar, the son of Aaron the chief priest;

name: Ezra 7:6
text: this Ezra went up from Babylon: and he was a ready scribe in the law of Moses, which Yahweh, the God of Israel, had given; and the king granted him all his request, according to the hand of Yahweh his God on him.

name: Ezra 7:7
text: There went up some of the children of Israel, and of the priests, and the Levites, and the singers, and the porters, and the Nethinim, to Jerusalem, in the seventh year of Artaxerxes the king.

name: Ezra 7:8
text: He came to Jerusalem in the fifth month, which was in the seventh year of the king.

name: Ezra 7:9
text: For on the first day of the first month began he to go up from Babylon; and on the first day of the fifth month came he to Jerusalem, according to the good hand of his God on him.

name: Ezra 7:10
text: For Ezra had set his heart to seek the law of Yahweh, and to do it, and to teach in Israel statutes and ordinances.

name: Ezra 7:11
text: Now this is the copy of the letter that the king Artaxerxes gave to Ezra the priest, the scribe, even the scribe of the words of the commandments of Yahweh, and of his statutes to Israel:

name: Ezra 7:12
text: Artaxerxes, king of kings, to Ezra the priest, the scribe of the law of the God of heaven, perfect and so forth.

name: Ezra 7:13
text: I make a decree, that all those of the people of Israel, and their priests and the Levites, in my realm, who are minded of their own free will to go to Jerusalem, go with you.

name: Ezra 7:14
text: Because you are sent of the king and his seven counselors, to inquire concerning Judah and Jerusalem, according to the law of your God which is in your hand,

name: Ezra 7:15
text: and to carry the silver and gold, which the king and his counselors have freely offered to the God of Israel, whose habitation is in Jerusalem,

name: Ezra 7:16
text: and all the silver and gold that you shall find in all the province of Babylon, with the freewill offering of the people, and of the priests, offering willingly for the house of their God which is in Jerusalem;

name: Ezra 7:17
text: therefore you shall with all diligence buy with this money bulls, rams, lambs, with their meal offerings and their drink offerings, and shall offer them on the altar of the house of your God which is in Jerusalem.

name: Ezra 7:18
text: Whatever shall seem good to you and to your brothers to do with the rest of the silver and the gold, do that after the will of your God.

name: Ezra 7:19
text: The vessels that are given to you for the service of the house of your God, deliver before the God of Jerusalem.

name: Ezra 7:20
text: Whatever more shall be needful for the house of your God, which you shall have occasion to bestow, bestow it out of the king"s treasure house.

name: Ezra 7:21
text: I, even I Artaxerxes the king, do make a decree to all the treasurers who are beyond the River, that whatever Ezra the priest, the scribe of the law of the God of heaven, shall require of you, it be done with all diligence,

name: Ezra 7:22
text: to one hundred talents of silver, and to one hundred measures of wheat, and to one hundred baths of wine, and to one hundred baths of oil, and salt without prescribing how much.

name: Ezra 7:23
text: Whatever is commanded by the God of heaven, let it be done exactly for the house of the God of heaven; for why should there be wrath against the realm of the king and his sons?

name: Ezra 7:24
text: Also we inform you, that touching any of the priests and Levites, the singers, porters, Nethinim, or servants of this house of God, it shall not be lawful to impose tribute, custom, or toll, on them.

name: Ezra 7:25
text: You, Ezra, after the wisdom of your God who is in your hand, appoint magistrates and judges, who may judge all the people who are beyond the River, all such as know the laws of your God; and teach him who doesn"t know them.

name: Ezra 7:26
text: Whoever will not do the law of your God, and the law of the king, let judgment be executed on him with all diligence, whether it be to death, or to banishment, or to confiscation of goods, or to imprisonment.

name: Ezra 7:27
text: Blessed be Yahweh, the God of our fathers, who has put such a thing as this in the king"s heart, to beautify the house of Yahweh which is in Jerusalem;

name: Ezra 7:28
text: and has extended loving kindness to me before the king, and his counselors, and before all the king"s mighty princes. I was strengthened according to the hand of Yahweh my God on me, and I gathered together out of Israel chief men to go up with me.

name: Ezra 8:1
text: Now these are the heads of their fathers" households, and this is the genealogy of those who went up with me from Babylon, in the reign of Artaxerxes the king:

name: Ezra 8:2
text: Of the sons of Phinehas, Gershom. Of the sons of Ithamar, Daniel. Of the sons of David, Hattush.

name: Ezra 8:3
text: Of the sons of Shecaniah, of the sons of Parosh, Zechariah; and with him were reckoned by genealogy of the males one hundred fifty.

name: Ezra 8:4
text: Of the sons of Pahathmoab, Eliehoenai the son of Zerahiah; and with him two hundred males.

name: Ezra 8:5
text: Of the sons of Shecaniah, the son of Jahaziel; and with him three hundred males.

name: Ezra 8:6
text: Of the sons of Adin, Ebed the son of Jonathan; and with him fifty males.

name: Ezra 8:7
text: Of the sons of Elam, Jeshaiah the son of Athaliah; and with him seventy males.

name: Ezra 8:8
text: Of the sons of Shephatiah, Zebadiah the son of Michael; and with him eighty males.

name: Ezra 8:9
text: Of the sons of Joab, Obadiah the son of Jehiel; and with him two hundred and eighteen males.

name: Ezra 8:10
text: Of the sons of Shelomith, the son of Josiphiah; and with him one hundred sixty males.

name: Ezra 8:11
text: Of the sons of Bebai, Zechariah the son of Bebai; and with him twenty-eight males.

name: Ezra 8:12
text: Of the sons of Azgad, Johanan the son of Hakkatan; and with him one hundred ten males.

name: Ezra 8:13
text: Of the sons of Adonikam, who were the last; and these are their names: Eliphelet, Jeuel, and Shemaiah; and with them sixty males.

name: Ezra 8:14
text: Of the sons of Bigvai, Uthai and Zabbud; and with them seventy males.

name: Ezra 8:15
text: I gathered them together to the river that runs to Ahava; and there we encamped three days: and I viewed the people, and the priests, and found there none of the sons of Levi.

name: Ezra 8:16
text: Then sent I for Eliezer, for Ariel, for Shemaiah, and for Elnathan, and for Jarib, and for Elnathan, and for Nathan, and for Zechariah, and for Meshullam, chief men; also for Joiarib, and for Elnathan, who were teachers.

name: Ezra 8:17
text: I sent them forth to Iddo the chief at the place Casiphia; and I told them what they should tell Iddo, and his brothers the Nethinim, at the place Casiphia, that they should bring to us ministers for the house of our God.

name: Ezra 8:18
text: According to the good hand of our God on us they brought us a man of discretion, of the sons of Mahli, the son of Levi, the son of Israel; and Sherebiah, with his sons and his brothers, eighteen;

name: Ezra 8:19
text: and Hashabiah, and with him Jeshaiah of the sons of Merari, his brothers and their sons, twenty;

name: Ezra 8:20
text: and of the Nethinim, whom David and the princes had given for the service of the Levites, two hundred and twenty Nethinim: all of them were mentioned by name.

name: Ezra 8:21
text: Then I proclaimed a fast there, at the river Ahava, that we might humble ourselves before our God, to seek of him a straight way for us, and for our little ones, and for all our substance.

name: Ezra 8:22
text: For I was ashamed to ask of the king a band of soldiers and horsemen to help us against the enemy in the way, because we had spoken to the king, saying, "The hand of our God is on all those who seek him, for good; but his power and his wrath is against all those who forsake him."

name: Ezra 8:23
text: So we fasted and begged our God for this: and he was entreated of us.

name: Ezra 8:24
text: Then I set apart twelve of the chiefs of the priests, even Sherebiah, Hashabiah, and ten of their brothers with them,

name: Ezra 8:25
text: and weighed to them the silver, and the gold, and the vessels, even the offering for the house of our God, which the king, and his counselors, and his princes, and all Israel there present, had offered:

name: Ezra 8:26
text: I weighed into their hand six hundred fifty talents of silver, and silver vessels one hundred talents; of gold one hundred talents;

name: Ezra 8:27
text: and twenty bowls of gold, of one thousand darics; and two vessels of fine bright brass, precious as gold.

name: Ezra 8:28
text: I said to them, "You are holy to Yahweh, and the vessels are holy; and the silver and the gold are a freewill offering to Yahweh, the God of your fathers.

name: Ezra 8:29
text: Watch, and keep them, until you weigh them before the chiefs of the priests and the Levites, and the princes of the fathers" households of Israel, at Jerusalem, in the rooms of the house of Yahweh."

name: Ezra 8:30
text: So the priests and the Levites received the weight of the silver and the gold, and the vessels, to bring them to Jerusalem to the house of our God.

name: Ezra 8:31
text: Then we departed from the river Ahava on the twelfth day of the first month, to go to Jerusalem: and the hand of our God was on us, and he delivered us from the hand of the enemy and the bandit by the way.

name: Ezra 8:32
text: We came to Jerusalem, and stayed there three days.

name: Ezra 8:33
text: On the fourth day the silver and the gold and the vessels were weighed in the house of our God into the hand of Meremoth the son of Uriah the priest; and with him was Eleazar the son of Phinehas; and with them was Jozabad the son of Jeshua, and Noadiah the son of Binnui, the Levite;

name: Ezra 8:34
text: the whole by number and by weight: and all the weight was written at that time.

name: Ezra 8:35
text: The children of the captivity, who had come out of exile, offered burnt offerings to the God of Israel, twelve bulls for all Israel, ninety-six rams, seventy-seven lambs, and twelve male goats for a sin offering: all this was a burnt offering to Yahweh.

name: Ezra 8:36
text: They delivered the king"s commissions to the king"s satraps, and to the governors beyond the River: and they furthered the people and the house of God.

name: Ezra 9:1
text: Now when these things were done, the princes drew near to me, saying, "The people of Israel, and the priests and the Levites, have not separated themselves from the peoples of the lands, following their abominations, even those of the Canaanites, the Hittites, the Perizzites, the Jebusites, the Ammonites, the Moabites, the Egyptians, and the Amorites.

name: Ezra 9:2
text: For they have taken of their daughters for themselves and for their sons, so that the holy seed have mixed themselves with the peoples of the lands. Yes, the hand of the princes and rulers has been chief in this trespass."

name: Ezra 9:3
text: When I heard this thing, I tore my garment and my robe, and plucked off the hair of my head and of my beard, and sat down confounded.

name: Ezra 9:4
text: Then were assembled to me everyone who trembled at the words of the God of Israel, because of their trespass of the captivity; and I sat confounded until the evening offering.

name: Ezra 9:5
text: At the evening offering I arose up from my humiliation, even with my garment and my robe torn; and I fell on my knees, and spread out my hands to Yahweh my God;

name: Ezra 9:6
text: and I said, "My God, I am ashamed and blush to lift up my face to you, my God; for our iniquities have increased over our head, and our guiltiness has grown up to the heavens.

name: Ezra 9:7
text: Since the days of our fathers we have been exceeding guilty to this day; and for our iniquities we, our kings, and our priests, have been delivered into the hand of the kings of the lands, to the sword, to captivity, to plunder, and to confusion of face, as it is this day.

name: Ezra 9:8
text: Now for a little moment grace has been shown from Yahweh our God, to leave us a remnant to escape, and to give us a nail in his holy place, that our God may lighten our eyes, and give us a little reviving in our bondage.

name: Ezra 9:9
text: For we are bondservants; yet our God has not forsaken us in our bondage, but has extended loving kindness to us in the sight of the kings of Persia, to give us a reviving, to set up the house of our God, and to repair its ruins, and to give us a wall in Judah and in Jerusalem.

name: Ezra 9:10
text: "Now, our God, what shall we say after this? For we have forsaken your commandments,

name: Ezra 9:11
text: which you have commanded by your servants the prophets, saying, "The land, to which you go to possess it, is an unclean land through the uncleanness of the peoples of the lands, through their abominations, which have filled it from one end to another with their filthiness.

name: Ezra 9:12
text: Now therefore don"t give your daughters to their sons, neither take their daughters to your sons, nor seek their peace or their prosperity forever; that you may be strong, and eat the good of the land, and leave it for an inheritance to your children forever."

name: Ezra 9:13
text: "After all that has come on us for our evil deeds, and for our great guilt, since you, our God, have punished us less than our iniquities deserve, and have given us such a remnant,

name: Ezra 9:14
text: shall we again break your commandments, and join in affinity with the peoples that do these abominations? Wouldn"t you be angry with us until you had consumed us, so that there should be no remnant, nor any to escape?

name: Ezra 9:15
text: Yahweh, the God of Israel, you are righteous; for we are left a remnant that has escaped, as it is this day. Behold, we are before you in our guiltiness; for none can stand before you because of this."

name: Ezra 10:1
text: Now while Ezra prayed and made confession, weeping and casting himself down before the house of God, there was gathered together to him out of Israel a very great assembly of men and women and children; for the people wept very bitterly.

name: Ezra 10:2
text: Shecaniah the son of Jehiel, one of the sons of Elam, answered Ezra, "We have trespassed against our God, and have married foreign women of the peoples of the land. Yet now there is hope for Israel concerning this thing.

name: Ezra 10:3
text: Now therefore let us make a covenant with our God to put away all the wives, and such as are born of them, according to the counsel of my lord, and of those who tremble at the commandment of our God. Let it be done according to the law.

name: Ezra 10:4
text: Arise; for the matter belongs to you, and we are with you. Be courageous, and do it."

name: Ezra 10:5
text: Then Ezra arose, and made the chiefs of the priests, the Levites, and all Israel, to swear that they would do according to this word. So they swore.

name: Ezra 10:6
text: Then Ezra rose up from before the house of God, and went into the room of Jehohanan the son of Eliashib: and when he came there, he ate no bread, nor drank water; for he mourned because of their trespass of the captivity.

name: Ezra 10:7
text: They made proclamation throughout Judah and Jerusalem to all the children of the captivity, that they should gather themselves together to Jerusalem;

name: Ezra 10:8
text: and that whoever didn"t come within three days, according to the counsel of the princes and the elders, all his substance should be forfeited, and himself separated from the assembly of the captivity.

name: Ezra 10:9
text: Then all the men of Judah and Benjamin gathered themselves together to Jerusalem within the three days; it was the ninth month, on the twentieth day of the month: and all the people sat in the broad place before the house of God, trembling because of this matter, and for the great rain.

name: Ezra 10:10
text: Ezra the priest stood up, and said to them, "You have trespassed, and have married foreign women, to increase the guilt of Israel.

name: Ezra 10:11
text: Now therefore make confession to Yahweh, the God of your fathers, and do his pleasure; and separate yourselves from the peoples of the land, and from the foreign women."

name: Ezra 10:12
text: Then all the assembly answered with a loud voice, "As you have said concerning us, so must we do.

name: Ezra 10:13
text: But the people are many, and it is a time of much rain, and we are not able to stand outside; neither is this a work of one day or two; for we have greatly transgressed in this matter.

name: Ezra 10:14
text: Let now our princes be appointed for all the assembly, and let all those who are in our cities who have married foreign women come at appointed times, and with them the elders of every city, and its judges, until the fierce wrath of our God be turned from us, until this matter is resolved."

name: Ezra 10:15
text: Only Jonathan the son of Asahel and Jahzeiah the son of Tikvah stood up against this; and Meshullam and Shabbethai the Levite helped them.

name: Ezra 10:16
text: The children of the captivity did so. Ezra the priest, with certain heads of fathers" households, after their fathers" houses, and all of them by their names, were set apart; and they sat down in the first day of the tenth month to examine the matter.

name: Ezra 10:17
text: They made an end with all the men who had married foreign women by the first day of the first month.

name: Ezra 10:18
text: Among the sons of the priests there were found who had married foreign women: of the sons of Jeshua, the son of Jozadak, and his brothers, Maaseiah, and Eliezer, and Jarib, and Gedaliah.

name: Ezra 10:19
text: They gave their hand that they would put away their wives; and being guilty, they offered a ram of the flock for their guilt.

name: Ezra 10:20
text: Of the sons of Immer: Hanani and Zebadiah.

name: Ezra 10:21
text: Of the sons of Harim: Maaseiah, and Elijah, and Shemaiah, and Jehiel, and Uzziah.

name: Ezra 10:22
text: Of the sons of Pashhur: Elioenai, Maaseiah, Ishmael, Nethanel, Jozabad, and Elasah.

name: Ezra 10:23
text: Of the Levites: Jozabad, and Shimei, and Kelaiah (the same is Kelita), Pethahiah, Judah, and Eliezer.

name: Ezra 10:24
text: Of the singers: Eliashib. Of the porters: Shallum, and Telem, and Uri.

name: Ezra 10:25
text: Of Israel: Of the sons of Parosh: Ramiah, and Izziah, and Malchijah, and Mijamin, and Eleazar, and Malchijah, and Benaiah.

name: Ezra 10:26
text: Of the sons of Elam: Mattaniah, Zechariah, and Jehiel, and Abdi, and Jeremoth, and Elijah.

name: Ezra 10:27
text: Of the sons of Zattu: Elioenai, Eliashib, Mattaniah, and Jeremoth, and Zabad, and Aziza.

name: Ezra 10:28
text: Of the sons of Bebai: Jehohanan, Hananiah, Zabbai, Athlai.

name: Ezra 10:29
text: Of the sons of Bani: Meshullam, Malluch, and Adaiah, Jashub, and Sheal, Jeremoth.

name: Ezra 10:30
text: Of the sons of Pahathmoab: Adna, and Chelal, Benaiah, Maaseiah, Mattaniah, Bezalel, and Binnui, and Manasseh.

name: Ezra 10:31
text: Of the sons of Harim: Eliezer, Isshijah, Malchijah, Shemaiah, Shimeon,

name: Ezra 10:32
text: Benjamin, Malluch, Shemariah.

name: Ezra 10:33
text: Of the sons of Hashum: Mattenai, Mattattah, Zabad, Eliphelet, Jeremai, Manasseh, Shimei.

name: Ezra 10:34
text: Of the sons of Bani: Maadai, Amram, and Uel,

name: Ezra 10:35
text: Benaiah, Bedeiah, Cheluhi,

name: Ezra 10:36
text: Vaniah, Meremoth, Eliashib,

name: Ezra 10:37
text: Mattaniah, Mattenai, and Jaasu,

name: Ezra 10:38
text: and Bani, and Binnui, Shimei,

name: Ezra 10:39
text: and Shelemiah, and Nathan, and Adaiah,

name: Ezra 10:40
text: Machnadebai, Shashai, Sharai,

name: Ezra 10:41
text: Azarel, and Shelemiah, Shemariah,

name: Ezra 10:42
text: Shallum, Amariah, Joseph.

name: Ezra 10:43
text: Of the sons of Nebo: Jeiel, Mattithiah, Zabad, Zebina, Iddo, and Joel, Benaiah.

name: Ezra 10:44
text: All these had taken foreign wives; and some of them had wives by whom they had children.

name: Nehemiah 1:1
text: The words of Nehemiah the son of Hacaliah. Now it happened in the month Chislev, in the twentieth year, as I was in Shushan the palace,

name: Nehemiah 1:2
text: that Hanani, one of my brothers, came, he and certain men out of Judah; and I asked them concerning the Jews who had escaped, who were left of the captivity, and concerning Jerusalem.

name: Nehemiah 1:3
text: They said to me, "The remnant who are left of the captivity there in the province are in great affliction and reproach. The wall of Jerusalem also is broken down, and its gates are burned with fire."

name: Nehemiah 1:4
text: It happened, when I heard these words, that I sat down and wept, and mourned certain days; and I fasted and prayed before the God of heaven,

name: Nehemiah 1:5
text: and said, "I beg you, Yahweh, the God of heaven, the great and awesome God, who keeps covenant and loving kindness with those who love him and keep his commandments:

name: Nehemiah 1:6
text: Let your ear now be attentive, and your eyes open, that you may listen to the prayer of your servant, which I pray before you at this time, day and night, for the children of Israel your servants while I confess the sins of the children of Israel, which we have sinned against you. Yes, I and my father"s house have sinned.

name: Nehemiah 1:7
text: We have dealt very corruptly against you, and have not kept the commandments, nor the statutes, nor the ordinances, which you commanded your servant Moses.

name: Nehemiah 1:8
text: "Remember, I beg you, the word that you commanded your servant Moses, saying, "If you trespass, I will scatter you abroad among the peoples;

name: Nehemiah 1:9
text: but if you return to me, and keep my commandments and do them, though your outcasts were in the uttermost part of the heavens, yet will I gather them from there, and will bring them to the place that I have chosen, to cause my name to dwell there."

name: Nehemiah 1:10
text: "Now these are your servants and your people, whom you have redeemed by your great power, and by your strong hand.

name: Nehemiah 1:11
text: Lord, I beg you, let your ear be attentive now to the prayer of your servant, and to the prayer of your servants, who delight to fear your name; and please prosper your servant this day, and grant him mercy in the sight of this man." Now I was cup bearer to the king.

name: Nehemiah 2:1
text: It happened in the month Nisan, in the twentieth year of Artaxerxes the king, when wine was before him, that I took up the wine, and gave it to the king. Now I had not been sad before in his presence.

name: Nehemiah 2:2
text: The king said to me, "Why is your face sad, since you are not sick? This is nothing else but sorrow of heart." Then I was very much afraid.

name: Nehemiah 2:3
text: I said to the king, "Let the king live forever! Why shouldn"t my face be sad, when the city, the place of my fathers" tombs, lies waste, and its gates have been consumed with fire?"

name: Nehemiah 2:4
text: Then the king said to me, "For what do you make request?" So I prayed to the God of heaven.

name: Nehemiah 2:5
text: I said to the king, "If it pleases the king, and if your servant has found favor in your sight, that you would send me to Judah, to the city of my fathers" tombs, that I may build it."

name: Nehemiah 2:6
text: The king said to me (the queen was also sitting by him), "For how long shall your journey be? And when will you return?" So it pleased the king to send me; and I set him a time.

name: Nehemiah 2:7
text: Moreover I said to the king, "If it pleases the king, let letters be given me to the governors beyond the River, that they may let me pass through until I come to Judah;

name: Nehemiah 2:8
text: and a letter to Asaph the keeper of the king"s forest, that he may give me timber to make beams for the gates of the citadel by the temple, for the wall of the city, and for the house that I shall enter into." The king granted my requests, because of the good hand of my God on me.

name: Nehemiah 2:9
text: Then I came to the governors beyond the River, and gave them the king"s letters. Now the king had sent with me captains of the army and horsemen.

name: Nehemiah 2:10
text: When Sanballat the Horonite, and Tobiah the servant, the Ammonite, heard of it, it grieved them exceedingly, because a man had come to seek the welfare of the children of Israel.

name: Nehemiah 2:11
text: So I came to Jerusalem, and was there three days.

name: Nehemiah 2:12
text: I arose in the night, I and some few men with me; neither told I any man what my God put into my heart to do for Jerusalem; neither was there any animal with me, except the animal that I rode on.

name: Nehemiah 2:13
text: I went out by night by the valley gate, even toward the jackal"s well, and to the dung gate, and viewed the walls of Jerusalem, which were broken down, and its gates were consumed with fire.

name: Nehemiah 2:14
text: Then I went on to the spring gate and to the king"s pool: but there was no place for the animal that was under me to pass.

name: Nehemiah 2:15
text: Then went I up in the night by the brook, and viewed the wall; and I turned back, and entered by the valley gate, and so returned.

name: Nehemiah 2:16
text: The rulers didn"t know where I went, or what I did; neither had I as yet told it to the Jews, nor to the priests, nor to the nobles, nor to the rulers, nor to the rest who did the work.

name: Nehemiah 2:17
text: Then I said to them, "You see the evil case that we are in, how Jerusalem lies waste, and its gates are burned with fire. Come, let us build up the wall of Jerusalem, that we won"t be disgraced."

name: Nehemiah 2:18
text: I told them of the hand of my God which was good on me, as also of the king"s words that he had spoken to me. They said, "Let"s rise up and build." So they strengthened their hands for the good work.

name: Nehemiah 2:19
text: But when Sanballat the Horonite, and Tobiah the servant, the Ammonite, and Geshem the Arabian, heard it, they ridiculed us, and despised us, and said, "What is this thing that you are doing? Will you rebel against the king?"

name: Nehemiah 2:20
text: Then answered I them, and said to them, "The God of heaven will prosper us. Therefore we, his servants, will arise and build; but you have no portion, nor right, nor memorial, in Jerusalem."

name: Nehemiah 3:1
text: Then Eliashib the high priest rose up with his brothers the priests, and they built the sheep gate; they sanctified it, and set up its doors; even to the tower of Hammeah they sanctified it, to the tower of Hananel.

name: Nehemiah 3:2
text: Next to him built the men of Jericho. Next to them built Zaccur the son of Imri.

name: Nehemiah 3:3
text: The sons of Hassenaah built the fish gate. They laid its beams, and set up its doors, its bolts, and its bars.

name: Nehemiah 3:4
text: Next to them, Meremoth the son of Uriah, the son of Hakkoz made repairs. Next to them, Meshullam the son of Berechiah, the son of Meshezabel made repairs. Next to them, Zadok the son of Baana made repairs.

name: Nehemiah 3:5
text: Next to them, the Tekoites made repairs; but their nobles didn"t put their necks to the work of their lord.

name: Nehemiah 3:6
text: Joiada the son of Paseah and Meshullam the son of Besodeiah repaired the old gate. They laid its beams, and set up its doors, and its bolts, and its bars.

name: Nehemiah 3:7
text: Next to them, Melatiah the Gibeonite, and Jadon the Meronothite, the men of Gibeon, and of Mizpah, repaired the residence of the governor beyond the River.

name: Nehemiah 3:8
text: Next to him, Uzziel the son of Harhaiah, goldsmiths, made repairs. Next to him, Hananiah one of the perfumers made repairs, and they fortified Jerusalem even to the broad wall.

name: Nehemiah 3:9
text: Next to them, Rephaiah the son of Hur, the ruler of half the district of Jerusalem, made repairs.

name: Nehemiah 3:10
text: Next to them, Jedaiah the son of Harumaph made repairs across from his house. Next to him, Hattush the son of Hashabneiah made repairs.

name: Nehemiah 3:11
text: Malchijah the son of Harim, and Hasshub the son of Pahathmoab, repaired another portion, and the tower of the furnaces.

name: Nehemiah 3:12
text: Next to him, Shallum the son of Hallohesh, the ruler of half the district of Jerusalem, he and his daughters, made repairs.

name: Nehemiah 3:13
text: Hanun and the inhabitants of Zanoah repaired the valley gate. They built it, and set up its doors, its bolts, and its bars, and one thousand cubits of the wall to the dung gate.

name: Nehemiah 3:14
text: Malchijah the son of Rechab, the ruler of the district of Beth Haccherem repaired the dung gate. He built it, and set up its doors, its bolts, and its bars.

name: Nehemiah 3:15
text: Shallun the son of Colhozeh, the ruler of the district of Mizpah repaired the spring gate. He built it, and covered it, and set up its doors, its bolts, and its bars, and the wall of the pool of Shelah by the king"s garden, even to the stairs that go down from the city of David.

name: Nehemiah 3:16
text: After him, Nehemiah the son of Azbuk, the ruler of half the district of Beth Zur, made repairs to the place opposite the tombs of David, and to the pool that was made, and to the house of the mighty men.

name: Nehemiah 3:17
text: After him, the Levites, Rehum the son of Bani made repairs. Next to him, Hashabiah, the ruler of half the district of Keilah, made repairs for his district.

name: Nehemiah 3:18
text: After him, their brothers, Bavvai the son of Henadad, the ruler of half the district of Keilah made repairs.

name: Nehemiah 3:19
text: Next to him, Ezer the son of Jeshua, the ruler of Mizpah, repaired another portion, across from the ascent to the armory at the turning of the wall.

name: Nehemiah 3:20
text: After him, Baruch the son of Zabbai earnestly repaired another portion, from the turning of the wall to the door of the house of Eliashib the high priest.

name: Nehemiah 3:21
text: After him, Meremoth the son of Uriah the son of Hakkoz repaired another portion, from the door of the house of Eliashib even to the end of the house of Eliashib.

name: Nehemiah 3:22
text: After him, the priests, the men of the Plain made repairs.

name: Nehemiah 3:23
text: After them, Benjamin and Hasshub made repairs across from their house. After them, Azariah the son of Maaseiah the son of Ananiah made repairs beside his own house.

name: Nehemiah 3:24
text: After him, Binnui the son of Henadad repaired another portion, from the house of Azariah to the turning of the wall, and to the corner.

name: Nehemiah 3:25
text: Palal the son of Uzai made repairs opposite the turning of the wall, and the tower that stands out from the upper house of the king, which is by the court of the guard. After him Pedaiah the son of Parosh made repairs.

name: Nehemiah 3:26
text: (Now the Nethinim lived in Ophel, to the place over against the water gate toward the east, and the tower that stands out.)

name: Nehemiah 3:27
text: After him the Tekoites repaired another portion, over against the great tower that stands out, and to the wall of Ophel.

name: Nehemiah 3:28
text: Above the horse gate, the priests made repairs, everyone across from his own house.

name: Nehemiah 3:29
text: After them, Zadok the son of Immer made repairs across from his own house. After him, Shemaiah the son of Shecaniah, the keeper of the east gate made repairs.

name: Nehemiah 3:30
text: After him, Hananiah the son of Shelemiah, and Hanun the sixth son of Zalaph, repaired another portion. After him, Meshullam the son of Berechiah made repairs across from his room.

name: Nehemiah 3:31
text: After him, Malchijah one of the goldsmiths to the house of the Nethinim, and of the merchants, made repairs over against the gate of Hammiphkad, and to the ascent of the corner.

name: Nehemiah 3:32
text: Between the ascent of the corner and the sheep gate, the goldsmiths and the merchants made repairs.

name: Nehemiah 4:1
text: But it happened that when Sanballat heard that we were building the wall, he was angry, and took great indignation, and mocked the Jews.

name: Nehemiah 4:2
text: He spoke before his brothers and the army of Samaria, and said, "What are these feeble Jews doing? Will they fortify themselves? Will they sacrifice? Will they finish in a day? Will they revive the stones out of the heaps of rubbish, since they are burned?"

name: Nehemiah 4:3
text: Now Tobiah the Ammonite was by him, and he said, "What they are building, if a fox climbed up it, he would break down their stone wall."

name: Nehemiah 4:4
text: "Hear, our God; for we are despised; and turn back their reproach on their own head, give them up for a spoil in a land of captivity;

name: Nehemiah 4:5
text: don"t cover their iniquity, and don"t let their sin be blotted out from before you; for they have insulted the builders."

name: Nehemiah 4:6
text: So we built the wall; and all the wall was joined together to half its height: for the people had a mind to work.

name: Nehemiah 4:7
text: But it happened that when Sanballat, Tobiah, the Arabians, the Ammonites, and the Ashdodites heard that the repairing of the walls of Jerusalem went forward, and that the breaches began to be filled, then they were very angry;

name: Nehemiah 4:8
text: and they conspired all of them together to come and fight against Jerusalem, and to cause confusion therein.

name: Nehemiah 4:9
text: But we made our prayer to our God, and set a watch against them day and night, because of them.

name: Nehemiah 4:10
text: Judah said, "The strength of the bearers of burdens is fading, and there is much rubbish; so that we are not able to build the wall."

name: Nehemiah 4:11
text: Our adversaries said, "They shall not know, neither see, until we come into their midst, and kill them, and cause the work to cease."

name: Nehemiah 4:12
text: It happened that when the Jews who lived by them came, they said to us ten times from all places, "Wherever you turn, they will attack us."

name: Nehemiah 4:13
text: Therefore set I in the lowest parts of the space behind the wall, in the open places, I set the people after their families with their swords, their spears, and their bows.

name: Nehemiah 4:14
text: I looked, and rose up, and said to the nobles, and to the rulers, and to the rest of the people, "Don"t be afraid of them! Remember the Lord, who is great and awesome, and fight for your brothers, your sons, and your daughters, your wives, and your houses."

name: Nehemiah 4:15
text: It happened, when our enemies heard that it was known to us, and God had brought their counsel to nothing, that we returned all of us to the wall, everyone to his work.

name: Nehemiah 4:16
text: It happened from that time forth, that half of my servants worked in the work, and half of them held the spears, the shields, and the bows, and the coats of mail; and the rulers were behind all the house of Judah.

name: Nehemiah 4:17
text: They all built the wall and those who bore burdens loaded themselves; everyone with one of his hands worked in the work, and with the other held his weapon;

name: Nehemiah 4:18
text: and the builders, everyone wore his sword at his side, and so built. He who sounded the trumpet was by me.

name: Nehemiah 4:19
text: I said to the nobles, and to the rulers and to the rest of the people, "The work is great and large, and we are separated on the wall, one far from another.

name: Nehemiah 4:20
text: Wherever you hear the sound of the trumpet, rally there to us. Our God will fight for us."

name: Nehemiah 4:21
text: So we worked in the work: and half of them held the spears from the rising of the morning until the stars appeared.

name: Nehemiah 4:22
text: Likewise at the same time said I to the people, "Let everyone with his servant lodge within Jerusalem, that in the night they may be a guard to us, and may labor in the day."

name: Nehemiah 4:23
text: So neither I, nor my brothers, nor my servants, nor the men of the guard who followed me, none of us took off our clothes. Everyone took his weapon to the water.

name: Nehemiah 5:1
text: Then there arose a great cry of the people and of their wives against their brothers the Jews.

name: Nehemiah 5:2
text: For there were that said, "We, our sons and our daughters, are many. Let us get grain, that we may eat and live."

name: Nehemiah 5:3
text: Some also there were that said, "We are mortgaging our fields, and our vineyards, and our houses. Let us get grain, because of the famine."

name: Nehemiah 5:4
text: There were also some who said, "We have borrowed money for the king"s tribute using our fields and our vineyards as collateral.

name: Nehemiah 5:5
text: Yet now our flesh is as the flesh of our brothers, our children as their children. Behold, we bring into bondage our sons and our daughters to be servants, and some of our daughters have been brought into bondage. Neither is it in our power to help it; for other men have our fields and our vineyards."

name: Nehemiah 5:6
text: I was very angry when I heard their cry and these words.

name: Nehemiah 5:7
text: Then I consulted with myself, and contended with the nobles and the rulers, and said to them, "You exact usury, everyone of his brother." I held a great assembly against them.

name: Nehemiah 5:8
text: I said to them, "We, after our ability, have redeemed our brothers the Jews that were sold to the nations; and would you even sell your brothers, and should they be sold to us?" Then they held their peace, and found never a word.

name: Nehemiah 5:9
text: Also I said, "The thing that you do is not good. Ought you not to walk in the fear of our God, because of the reproach of the nations our enemies?

name: Nehemiah 5:10
text: I likewise, my brothers and my servants, lend them money and grain. Please let us stop this usury.

name: Nehemiah 5:11
text: Please restore to them, even this day, their fields, their vineyards, their olive groves, and their houses, also the hundredth part of the money, and of the grain, the new wine, and the oil, that you are charging them."

name: Nehemiah 5:12
text: Then they said, "We will restore them, and will require nothing of them; so will we do, even as you say." Then I called the priests, and took an oath of them, that they would do according to this promise.

name: Nehemiah 5:13
text: Also I shook out my lap, and said, "So may God shake out every man from his house, and from his labor, that doesn"t perform this promise; even thus be he shaken out, and emptied." All the assembly said, "Amen," and praised Yahweh. The people did according to this promise.

name: Nehemiah 5:14
text: Moreover from the time that I was appointed to be their governor in the land of Judah, from the twentieth year even to the two and thirtieth year of Artaxerxes the king, that is, twelve years, I and my brothers have not eaten the bread of the governor.

name: Nehemiah 5:15
text: But the former governors who were before me were supported by the people, and took bread and wine from them, besides forty shekels of silver; yes, even their servants ruled over the people: but I didn"t do so, because of the fear of God.

name: Nehemiah 5:16
text: Yes, also I continued in the work of this wall, neither bought we any land: and all my servants were gathered there to the work.

name: Nehemiah 5:17
text: Moreover there were at my table, of the Jews and the rulers, one hundred fifty men, besides those who came to us from among the nations that were around us.

name: Nehemiah 5:18
text: Now that which was prepared for one day was one ox and six choice sheep; also fowls were prepared for me, and once in ten days store of all sorts of wine: yet for all this I didn"t demand the bread of the governor, because the bondage was heavy on this people.

name: Nehemiah 5:19
text: Remember to me, my God, for good, all that I have done for this people.

name: Nehemiah 6:1
text: Now it happened, when it was reported to Sanballat and Tobiah, and to Geshem the Arabian, and to the rest of our enemies, that I had built the wall, and that there was no breach left therein; (though even to that time I had not set up the doors in the gates;)

name: Nehemiah 6:2
text: that Sanballat and Geshem sent to me, saying, "Come, let us meet together in the villages in the plain of Ono." But they intended to harm me.

name: Nehemiah 6:3
text: I sent messengers to them, saying, "I am doing a great work, so that I can"t come down. Why should the work cease, while I leave it, and come down to you?"

name: Nehemiah 6:4
text: They sent to me four times after this sort; and I answered them the same way.

name: Nehemiah 6:5
text: Then Sanballat sent his servant to me the same way the fifth time with an open letter in his hand,

name: Nehemiah 6:6
text: in which was written, "It is reported among the nations, and Gashmu says it, that you and the Jews intend to rebel. Because of that, you are building the wall. You would be their king, according to these words.

name: Nehemiah 6:7
text: You have also appointed prophets to preach of you at Jerusalem, saying, "There is a king in Judah!" Now it will be reported to the king according to these words. Come now therefore, and let us take counsel together."

name: Nehemiah 6:8
text: Then I sent to him, saying, "There are no such things done as you say, but you imagine them out of your own heart."

name: Nehemiah 6:9
text: For they all would have made us afraid, saying, "Their hands will be weakened from the work, that it not be done. But now, strengthen my hands."

name: Nehemiah 6:10
text: I went to the house of Shemaiah the son of Delaiah the son of Mehetabel, who was shut in at his home; and he said, "Let us meet together in the house of God, within the temple, and let us shut the doors of the temple; for they will come to kill you; yes, in the night will they come to kill you."

name: Nehemiah 6:11
text: I said, "Should such a man as I flee? Who is there that, being such as I, would go into the temple to save his life? I will not go in."

name: Nehemiah 6:12
text: I discerned, and behold, God had not sent him; but he pronounced this prophecy against me. Tobiah and Sanballat had hired him.

name: Nehemiah 6:13
text: He hired so that I would be afraid, do so, and sin, and that they might have material for an evil report, that they might reproach me.

name: Nehemiah 6:14
text: "Remember, my God, Tobiah and Sanballat according to these their works, and also the prophetess Noadiah, and the rest of the prophets, that would have put me in fear."

name: Nehemiah 6:15
text: So the wall was finished in the twenty-fifth day of Elul, in fifty-two days.

name: Nehemiah 6:16
text: It happened, when all our enemies heard of it, that all the nations that were about us were afraid, and were much cast down in their own eyes; for they perceived that this work was worked of our God.

name: Nehemiah 6:17
text: Moreover in those days the nobles of Judah sent many letters to Tobiah, and Tobiah"s letters came to them.

name: Nehemiah 6:18
text: For there were many in Judah sworn to him, because he was the son-in-law of Shecaniah the son of Arah; and his son Jehohanan had taken the daughter of Meshullam the son of Berechiah as wife.

name: Nehemiah 6:19
text: Also they spoke of his good deeds before me, and reported my words to him. Tobiah sent letters to put me in fear.

name: Nehemiah 7:1
text: Now it happened, when the wall was built, and I had set up the doors, and the porters and the singers and the Levites were appointed,

name: Nehemiah 7:2
text: that I put my brother Hanani, and Hananiah the governor of the castle, in charge of Jerusalem; for he was a faithful man, and feared God above many.

name: Nehemiah 7:3
text: I said to them, "Don"t let the gates of Jerusalem be opened until the sun is hot; and while they stand guard, let them shut the doors, and you bar them: and appoint watches of the inhabitants of Jerusalem, everyone in his watch, with everyone near his house."

name: Nehemiah 7:4
text: Now the city was wide and large; but the people were few therein, and the houses were not built.

name: Nehemiah 7:5
text: My God put into my heart to gather together the nobles, and the rulers, and the people, that they might be reckoned by genealogy. I found the book of the genealogy of those who came up at the first, and I found written therein:

name: Nehemiah 7:6
text: These are the children of the province, who went up out of the captivity of those who had been carried away, whom Nebuchadnezzar the king of Babylon had carried away, and who returned to Jerusalem and to Judah, everyone to his city;

name: Nehemiah 7:7
text: who came with Zerubbabel, Jeshua, Nehemiah, Azariah, Raamiah, Nahamani, Mordecai, Bilshan, Mispereth, Bigvai, Nehum, Baanah. The number of the men of the people of Israel:

name: Nehemiah 7:8
text: The children of Parosh, two thousand one hundred seventy-two.

name: Nehemiah 7:9
text: The children of Shephatiah, three hundred seventy-two.

name: Nehemiah 7:10
text: The children of Arah, six hundred fifty-two.

name: Nehemiah 7:11
text: The children of Pahathmoab, of the children of Jeshua and Joab, two thousand eight hundred eighteen.

name: Nehemiah 7:12
text: The children of Elam, one thousand two hundred fifty-four.

name: Nehemiah 7:13
text: The children of Zattu, eight hundred forty-five.

name: Nehemiah 7:14
text: The children of Zaccai, seven hundred sixty.

name: Nehemiah 7:15
text: The children of Binnui, six hundred forty-eight.

name: Nehemiah 7:16
text: The children of Bebai, six hundred twenty-eight.

name: Nehemiah 7:17
text: The children of Azgad, two thousand three hundred twenty-two.

name: Nehemiah 7:18
text: The children of Adonikam, six hundred sixty-seven.

name: Nehemiah 7:19
text: The children of Bigvai, two thousand sixty-seven.

name: Nehemiah 7:20
text: The children of Adin, six hundred fifty-five.

name: Nehemiah 7:21
text: The children of Ater, of Hezekiah, ninety-eight.

name: Nehemiah 7:22
text: The children of Hashum, three hundred Twenty-eight.

name: Nehemiah 7:23
text: The children of Bezai, three hundred twenty-four.

name: Nehemiah 7:24
text: The children of Hariph, one hundred twelve.

name: Nehemiah 7:25
text: The children of Gibeon, ninety-five.

name: Nehemiah 7:26
text: The men of Bethlehem and Netophah, one hundred eighty-eight.

name: Nehemiah 7:27
text: The men of Anathoth, one hundred twenty-eight.

name: Nehemiah 7:28
text: The men of Beth Azmaveth, forty-two.

name: Nehemiah 7:29
text: The men of Kiriath Jearim, Chephirah, and Beeroth, seven hundred forty-three.

name: Nehemiah 7:30
text: The men of Ramah and Geba, six hundred twenty-one.

name: Nehemiah 7:31
text: The men of Michmas, one hundred and twenty-two.

name: Nehemiah 7:32
text: The men of Bethel and Ai, a hundred twenty-three.

name: Nehemiah 7:33
text: The men of the other Nebo, fifty-two.

name: Nehemiah 7:34
text: The children of the other Elam, one thousand two hundred fifty-four.

name: Nehemiah 7:35
text: The children of Harim, three hundred twenty.

name: Nehemiah 7:36
text: The children of Jericho, three hundred forty-five.

name: Nehemiah 7:37
text: The children of Lod, Hadid, and Ono, seven hundred twenty-one.

name: Nehemiah 7:38
text: The children of Senaah, three thousand nine hundred thirty.

name: Nehemiah 7:39
text: The priests: The children of Jedaiah, of the house of Jeshua, nine hundred seventy-three.

name: Nehemiah 7:40
text: The children of Immer, one thousand fifty-two.

name: Nehemiah 7:41
text: The children of Pashhur, one thousand two hundred forty-seven.

name: Nehemiah 7:42
text: The children of Harim, one thousand seventeen.

name: Nehemiah 7:43
text: The Levites: the children of Jeshua, of Kadmiel, of the children of Hodevah, seventy-four.

name: Nehemiah 7:44
text: The singers: the children of Asaph, one hundred forty-eight.

name: Nehemiah 7:45
text: The porters: the children of Shallum, the children of Ater, the children of Talmon, the children of Akkub, the children of Hatita, the children of Shobai, one hundred thirty-eight.

name: Nehemiah 7:46
text: The Nethinim: the children of Ziha, the children of Hasupha, the children of Tabbaoth,

name: Nehemiah 7:47
text: the children of Keros, the children of Sia, the children of Padon,

name: Nehemiah 7:48
text: the children of Lebana, the children of Hagaba, the children of Salmai,

name: Nehemiah 7:49
text: the children of Hanan, the children of Giddel, the children of Gahar,

name: Nehemiah 7:50
text: the children of Reaiah, the children of Rezin, the children of Nekoda,

name: Nehemiah 7:51
text: the children of Gazzam, the children of Uzza, the children of Paseah.

name: Nehemiah 7:52
text: The children of Besai, the children of Meunim, the children of Nephushesim,

name: Nehemiah 7:53
text: the children of Bakbuk, the children of Hakupha, the children of Harhur,

name: Nehemiah 7:54
text: the children of Bazlith, the children of Mehida, the children of Harsha,

name: Nehemiah 7:55
text: the children of Barkos, the children of Sisera, the children of Temah,

name: Nehemiah 7:56
text: the children of Neziah, the children of Hatipha.

name: Nehemiah 7:57
text: The children of Solomon"s servants: the children of Sotai, the children of Sophereth, the children of Perida,

name: Nehemiah 7:58
text: the children of Jaala, the children of Darkon, the children of Giddel,

name: Nehemiah 7:59
text: the children of Shephatiah, the children of Hattil, the children of Pochereth Hazzebaim, the children of Amon.

name: Nehemiah 7:60
text: All the Nethinim, and the children of Solomon"s servants, were three hundred ninety-two.

name: Nehemiah 7:61
text: These were those who went up from Tel Melah, Tel Harsha, Cherub, Addon, and Immer; but they could not show their fathers" houses, nor their seed, whether they were of Israel:

name: Nehemiah 7:62
text: The children of Delaiah, the children of Tobiah, the children of Nekoda, six hundred forty-two.

name: Nehemiah 7:63
text: Of the priests: the children of Hobaiah, the children of Hakkoz, the children of Barzillai, who took a wife of the daughters of Barzillai the Gileadite, and was called after their name.

name: Nehemiah 7:64
text: These searched for their geneological records, but couldn"t find them. Therefore were they deemed polluted and put from the priesthood.

name: Nehemiah 7:65
text: The governor said to them, that they should not eat of the most holy things, until there stood up a priest with Urim and Thummim.

name: Nehemiah 7:66
text: The whole assembly together was forty-two thousand three hundred sixty,

name: Nehemiah 7:67
text: besides their male servants and their female servants, of whom there were seven thousand three hundred thirty-seven: and they had two hundred forty-five singing men and singing women.

name: Nehemiah 7:68
text: Their horses were seven hundred thirty-six; their mules, two hundred forty-five;

name: Nehemiah 7:69
text: their camels, four hundred thirty-five; their donkeys, six thousand seven hundred twenty.

name: Nehemiah 7:70
text: Some from among the heads of fathers" households gave to the work. The governor gave to the treasury one thousand darics of gold, fifty basins, and five hundred thirty priests" garments.

name: Nehemiah 7:71
text: Some of the heads of fathers" households gave into the treasury of the work twenty thousand darics of gold, and two thousand two hundred minas of silver.

name: Nehemiah 7:72
text: That which the rest of the people gave was twenty thousand darics of gold, and two thousand minas of silver, and sixty-seven priests" garments.

name: Nehemiah 7:73
text: So the priests, and the Levites, and the porters, and the singers, and some of the people, and the Nethinim, and all Israel, lived in their cities. When the seventh month had come, the children of Israel were in their cities.

name: Nehemiah 8:1
text: All the people gathered themselves together as one man into the broad place that was before the water gate; and they spoke to Ezra the scribe to bring the book of the law of Moses, which Yahweh had commanded to Israel.

name: Nehemiah 8:2
text: Ezra the priest brought the law before the assembly, both men and women, and all who could hear with understanding, on the first day of the seventh month.

name: Nehemiah 8:3
text: He read therein before the broad place that was before the water gate from early morning until midday, in the presence of the men and the women, and of those who could understand; and the ears of all the people were attentive to the book of the law.

name: Nehemiah 8:4
