text: Ezra the scribe stood on a pulpit of wood, which they had made for the purpose; and beside him stood Mattithiah, and Shema, and Anaiah, and Uriah, and Hilkiah, and Maaseiah, on his right hand; and on his left hand, Pedaiah, and Mishael, and Malchijah, and Hashum, and Hashbaddanah, Zechariah, and Meshullam.

name: Nehemiah 8:5
text: Ezra opened the book in the sight of all the people; (for he was above all the people;) and when he opened it, all the people stood up:

name: Nehemiah 8:6
text: and Ezra blessed Yahweh, the great God. All the people answered, "Amen, Amen," with the lifting up of their hands. They bowed their heads, and worshiped Yahweh with their faces to the ground.

name: Nehemiah 8:7
text: Also Jeshua, and Bani, and Sherebiah, Jamin, Akkub, Shabbethai, Hodiah, Maaseiah, Kelita, Azariah, Jozabad, Hanan, Pelaiah, and the Levites, caused the people to understand the law: and the people stayed in their place.

name: Nehemiah 8:8
text: They read in the book, in the law of God, distinctly; and they gave the sense, so that they understood the reading.

name: Nehemiah 8:9
text: Nehemiah, who was the governor, and Ezra the priest the scribe, and the Levites who taught the people, said to all the people, "This day is holy to Yahweh your God. Don"t mourn, nor weep." For all the people wept, when they heard the words of the law.

name: Nehemiah 8:10
text: Then he said to them, "Go your way. Eat the fat, drink the sweet, and send portions to him for whom nothing is prepared; for this day is holy to our Lord. Don"t be grieved; for the joy of Yahweh is your strength."

name: Nehemiah 8:11
text: So the Levites stilled all the people, saying, "Hold your peace, for the day is holy; neither be grieved."

name: Nehemiah 8:12
text: All the people went their way to eat, and to drink, and to send portions, and to make great mirth, because they had understood the words that were declared to them.

name: Nehemiah 8:13
text: On the second day were gathered together the heads of fathers" households of all the people, the priests, and the Levites, to Ezra the scribe, even to give attention to the words of the law.

name: Nehemiah 8:14
text: They found written in the law, how that Yahweh had commanded by Moses, that the children of Israel should dwell in booths in the feast of the seventh month;

name: Nehemiah 8:15
text: and that they should publish and proclaim in all their cities, and in Jerusalem, saying, "Go out to the mountain, and get olive branches, and branches of wild olive, and myrtle branches, and palm branches, and branches of thick trees, to make booths, as it is written."

name: Nehemiah 8:16
text: So the people went out, and brought them, and made themselves booths, everyone on the roof of his house, and in their courts, and in the courts of the house of God, and in the broad place of the water gate, and in the broad place of the gate of Ephraim.

name: Nehemiah 8:17
text: All the assembly of those who had come again out of the captivity made booths, and lived in the booths; for since the days of Jeshua the son of Nun to that day the children of Israel had not done so. There was very great gladness.

name: Nehemiah 8:18
text: Also day by day, from the first day to the last day, he read in the book of the law of God. They kept the feast seven days; and on the eighth day was a solemn assembly, according to the ordinance.

name: Nehemiah 9:1
text: Now in the twenty-fourth day of this month the children of Israel were assembled with fasting, and with sackcloth, and earth on them.

name: Nehemiah 9:2
text: The seed of Israel separated themselves from all foreigners, and stood and confessed their sins, and the iniquities of their fathers.

name: Nehemiah 9:3
text: They stood up in their place, and read in the book of the law of Yahweh their God a fourth part of the day; and a fourth part they confessed, and worshiped Yahweh their God.

name: Nehemiah 9:4
text: Then Jeshua, and Bani, Kadmiel, Shebaniah, Bunni, Sherebiah, Bani, and Chenani of the Levites stood up on the stairs, and cried with a loud voice to Yahweh their God.

name: Nehemiah 9:5
text: Then the Levites, Jeshua, and Kadmiel, Bani, Hashabneiah, Sherebiah, Hodiah, Shebaniah, and Pethahiah, said, "Stand up and bless Yahweh your God from everlasting to everlasting! Bessed be your glorious name, which is exalted above all blessing and praise!

name: Nehemiah 9:6
text: You are Yahweh, even you alone. You have made heaven, the heaven of heavens, with all their army, the earth and all things that are on it, the seas and all that is in them, and you preserve them all. The army of heaven worships you.

name: Nehemiah 9:7
text: You are Yahweh, the God who chose Abram, and brought him out of Ur of the Chaldees, and gave him the name of Abraham,

name: Nehemiah 9:8
text: and found his heart faithful before you, and made a covenant with him to give the land of the Canaanite, the Hittite, the Amorite, and the Perizzite, and the Jebusite, and the Girgashite, to give it to his seed, and have performed your words; for you are righteous.

name: Nehemiah 9:9
text: "You saw the affliction of our fathers in Egypt, and heard their cry by the Red Sea,

name: Nehemiah 9:10
text: and showed signs and wonders against Pharaoh, and against all his servants, and against all the people of his land; for you knew that they dealt proudly against them, and made a name for yourself, as it is this day.

name: Nehemiah 9:11
text: You divided the sea before them, so that they went through the midst of the sea on the dry land; and you cast their pursuers into the depths, as a stone into the mighty waters.

name: Nehemiah 9:12
text: Moreover, in a pillar of cloud you led them by day; and in a pillar of fire by night, to give them light in the way in which they should go.

name: Nehemiah 9:13
text: "You came down also on Mount Sinai, and spoke with them from heaven, and gave them right ordinances and true laws, good statutes and commandments,

name: Nehemiah 9:14
text: and made known to them your holy Sabbath, and commanded them commandments, and statutes, and a law, by Moses your servant,

name: Nehemiah 9:15
text: and gave them bread from the sky for their hunger, and brought forth water for them out of the rock for their thirst, and commanded them that they should go in to possess the land which you had sworn to give them.

name: Nehemiah 9:16
text: "But they and our fathers dealt proudly and hardened their neck, didn"t listen to your commandments,

name: Nehemiah 9:17
text: and refused to obey, neither were they mindful of your wonders that you did among them, but hardened their neck, and in their rebellion appointed a captain to return to their bondage. But you are a God ready to pardon, gracious and merciful, slow to anger, and abundant in loving kindness, and didn"t forsake them.

name: Nehemiah 9:18
text: Yes, when they had made them a molten calf, and said, "This is your God who brought you up out of Egypt," and had committed awful blasphemies;

name: Nehemiah 9:19
text: yet you in your manifold mercies didn"t forsake them in the wilderness: the pillar of cloud didn"t depart from over them by day, to lead them in the way; neither the pillar of fire by night, to show them light, and the way in which they should go.

name: Nehemiah 9:20
text: You gave also your good Spirit to instruct them, and didn"t withhold your manna from their mouth, and gave them water for their thirst.

name: Nehemiah 9:21
text: "Yes, forty years you sustained them in the wilderness. They lacked nothing. Their clothes didn"t grow old, and their feet didn"t swell.

name: Nehemiah 9:22
text: Moreover you gave them kingdoms and peoples, which you allotted according to their portions. So they possessed the land of Sihon, even the land of the king of Heshbon, and the land of Og king of Bashan.

name: Nehemiah 9:23
text: You also multiplied their children as the stars of the sky, and brought them into the land concerning which you said to their fathers, that they should go in to possess it.

name: Nehemiah 9:24
text: "So the children went in and possessed the land, and you subdued before them the inhabitants of the land, the Canaanites, and gave them into their hands, with their kings, and the peoples of the land, that they might do with them as they pleased.

name: Nehemiah 9:25
text: They took fortified cities, and a rich land, and possessed houses full of all good things, cisterns dug out, vineyards, and olive groves, and fruit trees in abundance. So they ate, were filled, became fat, and delighted themselves in your great goodness.

name: Nehemiah 9:26
text: "Nevertheless they were disobedient, and rebelled against you, and cast your law behind their back, and killed your prophets that testified against them to turn them again to you, and they committed awful blasphemies.

name: Nehemiah 9:27
text: Therefore you delivered them into the hand of their adversaries, who distressed them. In the time of their trouble, when they cried to you, you heard from heaven; and according to your manifold mercies you gave them saviors who saved them out of the hand of their adversaries.

name: Nehemiah 9:28
text: But after they had rest, they did evil again before you; therefore left you them in the hand of their enemies, so that they had the dominion over them; yet when they returned, and cried to you, you heard from heaven; and many times you delivered them according to your mercies,

name: Nehemiah 9:29
text: and testified against them, that you might bring them again to your law. Yet they dealt proudly, and didn"t listen to your commandments, but sinned against your ordinances, (which if a man does, he shall live in them), turned their backs, stiffened their neck, and would not hear.

name: Nehemiah 9:30
text: Yet many years you put up with them, and testified against them by your Spirit through your prophets. Yet would they not give ear. Therefore you gave them into the hand of the peoples of the lands.

name: Nehemiah 9:31
text: "Nevertheless in your manifold mercies you did not make a full end of them, nor forsake them; for you are a gracious and merciful God.

name: Nehemiah 9:32
text: Now therefore, our God, the great, the mighty, and the awesome God, who keeps covenant and loving kindness, don"t let all the travail seem little before you, that has come on us, on our kings, on our princes, and on our priests, and on our prophets, and on our fathers, and on all your people, since the time of the kings of Assyria to this day.

name: Nehemiah 9:33
text: However you are just in all that has come on us; for you have dealt truly, but we have done wickedly;

name: Nehemiah 9:34
text: neither have our kings, our princes, our priests, nor our fathers, kept your law, nor listened to your commandments and your testimonies with which you testified against them.

name: Nehemiah 9:35
text: For they have not served you in their kingdom, and in your great goodness that you gave them, and in the large and rich land which you gave before them, neither did they turn from their wicked works.

name: Nehemiah 9:36
text: "Behold, we are servants this day, and as for the land that you gave to our fathers to eat its fruit and its good, behold, we are servants in it.

name: Nehemiah 9:37
text: It yields much increase to the kings whom you have set over us because of our sins: also they have power over our bodies, and over our livestock, at their pleasure, and we are in great distress.

name: Nehemiah 9:38
text: Yet for all this, we make a sure covenant, and write it; and our princes, our Levites, and our priests, seal it."

name: Nehemiah 10:1
text: Now those who sealed were: Nehemiah the governor, the son of Hacaliah, and Zedekiah,

name: Nehemiah 10:2
text: Seraiah, Azariah, Jeremiah,

name: Nehemiah 10:3
text: Pashhur, Amariah, Malchijah,

name: Nehemiah 10:4
text: Hattush, Shebaniah, Malluch,

name: Nehemiah 10:5
text: Harim, Meremoth, Obadiah,

name: Nehemiah 10:6
text: Daniel, Ginnethon, Baruch,

name: Nehemiah 10:7
text: Meshullam, Abijah, Mijamin,

name: Nehemiah 10:8
text: Maaziah, Bilgai, Shemaiah; these were the priests.

name: Nehemiah 10:9
text: The Levites: namely, Jeshua the son of Azaniah, Binnui of the sons of Henadad, Kadmiel;

name: Nehemiah 10:10
text: and their brothers, Shebaniah, Hodiah, Kelita, Pelaiah, Hanan,

name: Nehemiah 10:11
text: Mica, Rehob, Hashabiah,

name: Nehemiah 10:12
text: Zaccur, Sherebiah, Shebaniah,

name: Nehemiah 10:13
text: Hodiah, Bani, Beninu.

name: Nehemiah 10:14
text: The chiefs of the people: Parosh, Pahathmoab, Elam, Zattu, Bani,

name: Nehemiah 10:15
text: Bunni, Azgad, Bebai,

name: Nehemiah 10:16
text: Adonijah, Bigvai, Adin,

name: Nehemiah 10:17
text: Ater, Hezekiah, Azzur,

name: Nehemiah 10:18
text: Hodiah, Hashum, Bezai,

name: Nehemiah 10:19
text: Hariph, Anathoth, Nobai,

name: Nehemiah 10:20
text: Magpiash, Meshullam, Hezir,

name: Nehemiah 10:21
text: Meshezabel, Zadok, Jaddua,

name: Nehemiah 10:22
text: Pelatiah, Hanan, Anaiah,

name: Nehemiah 10:23
text: Hoshea, Hananiah, Hasshub,

name: Nehemiah 10:24
text: Hallohesh, Pilha, Shobek,

name: Nehemiah 10:25
text: Rehum, Hashabnah, Maaseiah,

name: Nehemiah 10:26
text: and Ahiah, Hanan, Anan,

name: Nehemiah 10:27
text: Malluch, Harim, Baanah.

name: Nehemiah 10:28
text: The rest of the people, the priests, the Levites, the porters, the singers, the Nethinim, and all those who had separated themselves from the peoples of the lands to the law of God, their wives, their sons, and their daughters, everyone who had knowledge, and understanding"

name: Nehemiah 10:29
text: they joined with their brothers, their nobles, and entered into a curse, and into an oath, to walk in God"s law, which was given by Moses the servant of God, and to observe and do all the commandments of Yahweh our Lord, and his ordinances and his statutes;

name: Nehemiah 10:30
text: and that we would not give our daughters to the peoples of the land, nor take their daughters for our sons;

name: Nehemiah 10:31
text: and if the peoples of the land bring wares or any grain on the Sabbath day to sell, that we would not buy of them on the Sabbath, or on a holy day; and that we would forego the seventh year, and the exaction of every debt.

name: Nehemiah 10:32
text: Also we made ordinances for ourselves, to charge ourselves yearly with the third part of a shekel for the service of the house of our God;

name: Nehemiah 10:33
text: for the show bread, and for the continual meal offering, and for the continual burnt offering, for the Sabbaths, for the new moons, for the set feasts, and for the holy things, and for the sin offerings to make atonement for Israel, and for all the work of the house of our God.

name: Nehemiah 10:34
text: We cast lots, the priests, the Levites, and the people, for the wood offering, to bring it into the house of our God, according to our fathers" houses, at times appointed, year by year, to burn on the altar of Yahweh our God, as it is written in the law;

name: Nehemiah 10:35
text: and to bring the first fruits of our ground, and the first fruits of all fruit of all kinds of trees, year by year, to the house of Yahweh;

name: Nehemiah 10:36
text: also the firstborn of our sons, and of our livestock, as it is written in the law, and the firstborn of our herds and of our flocks, to bring to the house of our God, to the priests who minister in the house of our God;

name: Nehemiah 10:37
text: and that we should bring the first fruits of our dough, and our wave offerings, and the fruit of all kinds of trees, the new wine and the oil, to the priests, to the rooms of the house of our God; and the tithes of our ground to the Levites; for they, the Levites, take the tithes in all the cities of our tillage.

name: Nehemiah 10:38
text: The priest the son of Aaron shall be with the Levites, when the Levites take tithes: and the Levites shall bring up the tithe of the tithes to the house of our God, to the rooms, into the treasure house.

name: Nehemiah 10:39
text: For the children of Israel and the children of Levi shall bring the wave offering of the grain, of the new wine, and of the oil, to the rooms, where are the vessels of the sanctuary, and the priests who minister, and the porters, and the singers. We will not forsake the house of our God.

name: Nehemiah 11:1
text: The princes of the people lived in Jerusalem: the rest of the people also cast lots, to bring one of ten to dwell in Jerusalem the holy city, and nine parts in the other cities.

name: Nehemiah 11:2
text: The people blessed all the men who willingly offered themselves to dwell in Jerusalem.

name: Nehemiah 11:3
text: Now these are the chiefs of the province who lived in Jerusalem; but in the cities of Judah everyone lived in his possession in their cities: Israel, the priests, and the Levites, and the Nethinim, and the children of Solomon"s servants.

name: Nehemiah 11:4
text: In Jerusalem lived certain of the children of Judah, and of the children of Benjamin. Of the children of Judah: Athaiah the son of Uzziah, the son of Zechariah, the son of Amariah, the son of Shephatiah, the son of Mahalalel, of the children of Perez;

name: Nehemiah 11:5
text: and Maaseiah the son of Baruch, the son of Colhozeh, the son of Hazaiah, the son of Adaiah, the son of Joiarib, the son of Zechariah, the son of the Shilonite.

name: Nehemiah 11:6
text: All the sons of Perez who lived in Jerusalem were four hundred sixty-eight valiant men.

name: Nehemiah 11:7
text: These are the sons of Benjamin: Sallu the son of Meshullam, the son of Joed, the son of Pedaiah, the son of Kolaiah, the son of Maaseiah, the son of Ithiel, the son of Jeshaiah.

name: Nehemiah 11:8
text: After him Gabbai, Sallai, nine hundred twenty-eight.

name: Nehemiah 11:9
text: Joel the son of Zichri was their overseer; and Judah the son of Hassenuah was second over the city.

name: Nehemiah 11:10
text: Of the priests: Jedaiah the son of Joiarib, Jachin,

name: Nehemiah 11:11
text: Seraiah the son of Hilkiah, the son of Meshullam, the son of Zadok, the son of Meraioth, the son of Ahitub, the ruler of the house of God,

name: Nehemiah 11:12
text: and their brothers who did the work of the house, eight hundred twenty-two; and Adaiah the son of Jeroham, the son of Pelaliah, the son of Amzi, the son of Zechariah, the son of Pashhur, the son of Malchijah,

name: Nehemiah 11:13
text: and his brothers, chiefs of fathers" households, two hundred forty-two; and Amashsai the son of Azarel, the son of Ahzai, the son of Meshillemoth, the son of Immer,

name: Nehemiah 11:14
text: and their brothers, mighty men of valor, one hundred twenty-eight; and their overseer was Zabdiel, the son of Haggedolim.

name: Nehemiah 11:15
text: Of the Levites: Shemaiah the son of Hasshub, the son of Azrikam, the son of Hashabiah, the son of Bunni;

name: Nehemiah 11:16
text: and Shabbethai and Jozabad, of the chiefs of the Levites, who had the oversight of the outward business of the house of God;

name: Nehemiah 11:17
text: and Mattaniah the son of Mica, the son of Zabdi, the son of Asaph, who was the chief to begin the thanksgiving in prayer, and Bakbukiah, the second among his brothers; and Abda the son of Shammua, the son of Galal, the son of Jeduthun.

name: Nehemiah 11:18
text: All the Levites in the holy city were two hundred eighty-four.

name: Nehemiah 11:19
text: Moreover the porters, Akkub, Talmon, and their brothers, who kept watch at the gates, were one hundred seventy-two.

name: Nehemiah 11:20
text: The residue of Israel, of the priests, the Levites, were in all the cities of Judah, everyone in his inheritance.

name: Nehemiah 11:21
text: But the Nethinim lived in Ophel: and Ziha and Gishpa were over the Nethinim.

name: Nehemiah 11:22
text: The overseer also of the Levites at Jerusalem was Uzzi the son of Bani, the son of Hashabiah, the son of Mattaniah, the son of Mica, of the sons of Asaph, the singers, over the business of the house of God.

name: Nehemiah 11:23
text: For there was a commandment from the king concerning them, and a settled provision for the singers, as every day required.

name: Nehemiah 11:24
text: Pethahiah the son of Meshezabel, of the children of Zerah the son of Judah, was at the king"s hand in all matters concerning the people.

name: Nehemiah 11:25
text: As for the villages, with their fields, some of the children of Judah lived in Kiriath Arba and its towns, and in Dibon and its towns, and in Jekabzeel and its villages,

name: Nehemiah 11:26
text: and in Jeshua, and in Moladah, and Beth Pelet,

name: Nehemiah 11:27
text: and in Hazar Shual, and in Beersheba and its towns,

name: Nehemiah 11:28
text: and in Ziklag, and in Meconah and in its towns,

name: Nehemiah 11:29
text: and in En Rimmon, and in Zorah, and in Jarmuth,

name: Nehemiah 11:30
text: Zanoah, Adullam, and their villages, Lachish and its fields, Azekah and its towns. So they encamped from Beersheba to the valley of Hinnom.

name: Nehemiah 11:31
text: The children of Benjamin also lived from Geba onward, at Michmash and Aija, and at Bethel and its towns,

name: Nehemiah 11:32
text: at Anathoth, Nob, Ananiah,

name: Nehemiah 11:33
text: Hazor, Ramah, Gittaim,

name: Nehemiah 11:34
text: Hadid, Zeboim, Neballat,

name: Nehemiah 11:35
text: Lod, and Ono, the valley of craftsmen.

name: Nehemiah 11:36
text: Of the Levites, certain divisions in Judah settled in Benjamin"s territory.

name: Nehemiah 12:1
text: Now these are the priests and the Levites who went up with Zerubbabel the son of Shealtiel, and Jeshua: Seraiah, Jeremiah, Ezra,

name: Nehemiah 12:2
text: Amariah, Malluch, Hattush,

name: Nehemiah 12:3
text: Shecaniah, Rehum, Meremoth,

name: Nehemiah 12:4
text: Iddo, Ginnethoi, Abijah,

name: Nehemiah 12:5
text: Mijamin, Maadiah, Bilgah,

name: Nehemiah 12:6
text: Shemaiah, and Joiarib, Jedaiah.

name: Nehemiah 12:7
text: Sallu, Amok, Hilkiah, Jedaiah. These were the chiefs of the priests and of their brothers in the days of Jeshua.

name: Nehemiah 12:8
text: Moreover the Levites: Jeshua, Binnui, Kadmiel, Sherebiah, Judah, and Mattaniah, who was over the thanksgiving, he and his brothers.

name: Nehemiah 12:9
text: Also Bakbukiah and Unno, their brothers, were over against them according to their offices.

name: Nehemiah 12:10
text: Jeshua became the father of Joiakim, and Joiakim became the father of Eliashib, and Eliashib became the father of Joiada,

name: Nehemiah 12:11
text: and Joiada became the father of Jonathan, and Jonathan became the father of Jaddua.

name: Nehemiah 12:12
text: In the days of Joiakim were priests, heads of fathers" households: of Seraiah, Meraiah; of Jeremiah, Hananiah;

name: Nehemiah 12:13
text: of Ezra, Meshullam; of Amariah, Jehohanan;

name: Nehemiah 12:14
text: of Malluchi, Jonathan; of Shebaniah, Joseph;

name: Nehemiah 12:15
text: of Harim, Adna; of Meraioth, Helkai;

name: Nehemiah 12:16
text: of Iddo, Zechariah; of Ginnethon, Meshullam;

name: Nehemiah 12:17
text: of Abijah, Zichri; of Miniamin, of Moadiah, Piltai;

name: Nehemiah 12:18
text: of Bilgah, Shammua; of Shemaiah, Jehonathan;

name: Nehemiah 12:19
text: and of Joiarib, Mattenai; of Jedaiah, Uzzi;

name: Nehemiah 12:20
text: of Sallai, Kallai; of Amok, Eber;

name: Nehemiah 12:21
text: of Hilkiah, Hashabiah; of Jedaiah, Nethanel.

name: Nehemiah 12:22
text: As for the Levites, in the days of Eliashib, Joiada, and Johanan, and Jaddua, there were recorded the heads of fathers" households; also the priests, in the reign of Darius the Persian.

name: Nehemiah 12:23
text: The sons of Levi, heads of fathers" households, were written in the book of the chronicles, even until the days of Johanan the son of Eliashib.

name: Nehemiah 12:24
text: The chiefs of the Levites: Hashabiah, Sherebiah, and Jeshua the son of Kadmiel, with their brothers over against them, to praise and give thanks, according to the commandment of David the man of God, watch next to watch.

name: Nehemiah 12:25
text: Mattaniah, and Bakbukiah, Obadiah, Meshullam, Talmon, Akkub, were porters keeping the watch at the storehouses of the gates.

name: Nehemiah 12:26
text: These were in the days of Joiakim the son of Jeshua, the son of Jozadak, and in the days of Nehemiah the governor, and of Ezra the priest the scribe.

name: Nehemiah 12:27
text: At the dedication of the wall of Jerusalem they sought the Levites out of all their places, to bring them to Jerusalem, to keep the dedication with gladness, both with giving thanks, and with singing, with cymbals, stringed instruments, and with harps.

name: Nehemiah 12:28
text: The sons of the singers gathered themselves together, both out of the plain around Jerusalem, and from the villages of the Netophathites;

name: Nehemiah 12:29
text: also from Beth Gilgal, and out of the fields of Geba and Azmaveth: for the singers had built them villages around Jerusalem.

name: Nehemiah 12:30
text: The priests and the Levites purified themselves; and they purified the people, and the gates, and the wall.

name: Nehemiah 12:31
text: Then I brought up the princes of Judah on the wall, and appointed two great companies who gave thanks and went in procession. One went on the right hand on the wall toward the dung gate;

name: Nehemiah 12:32
text: and after them went Hoshaiah, and half of the princes of Judah,

name: Nehemiah 12:33
text: and Azariah, Ezra, and Meshullam,

name: Nehemiah 12:34
text: Judah, and Benjamin, and Shemaiah, and Jeremiah,

name: Nehemiah 12:35
text: and certain of the priests" sons with trumpets: Zechariah the son of Jonathan, the son of Shemaiah, the son of Mattaniah, the son of Micaiah, the son of Zaccur, the son of Asaph;

name: Nehemiah 12:36
text: and his brothers, Shemaiah, and Azarel, Milalai, Gilalai, Maai, Nethanel, and Judah, Hanani, with the musical instruments of David the man of God; and Ezra the scribe was before them.

name: Nehemiah 12:37
text: By the spring gate, and straight before them, they went up by the stairs of the city of David, at the ascent of the wall, above the house of David, even to the water gate eastward.

name: Nehemiah 12:38
text: The other company of those who gave thanks went to meet them, and I after them, with the half of the people, on the wall, above the tower of the furnaces, even to the broad wall,

name: Nehemiah 12:39
text: and above the gate of Ephraim, and by the old gate, and by the fish gate, and the tower of Hananel, and the tower of Hammeah, even to the sheep gate: and they stood still in the gate of the guard.

name: Nehemiah 12:40
text: So stood the two companies of those who gave thanks in the house of God, and I, and the half of the rulers with me;

name: Nehemiah 12:41
text: and the priests, Eliakim, Maaseiah, Miniamin, Micaiah, Elioenai, Zechariah, and Hananiah, with trumpets;

name: Nehemiah 12:42
text: and Maaseiah, and Shemaiah, and Eleazar, and Uzzi, and Jehohanan, and Malchijah, and Elam, and Ezer. The singers sang loud, with Jezrahiah their overseer.

name: Nehemiah 12:43
text: They offered great sacrifices that day, and rejoiced; for God had made them rejoice with great joy; and the women also and the children rejoiced: so that the joy of Jerusalem was heard even afar off.

name: Nehemiah 12:44
text: On that day were men appointed over the rooms for the treasures, for the wave offerings, for the first fruits, and for the tithes, to gather into them, according to the fields of the cities, the portions appointed by the law for the priests and Levites: for Judah rejoiced for the priests and for the Levites who waited.

name: Nehemiah 12:45
text: They performed the duty of their God, and the duty of the purification, and so did the singers and the porters, according to the commandment of David, and of Solomon his son.

name: Nehemiah 12:46
text: For in the days of David and Asaph of old there was a chief of the singers, and songs of praise and thanksgiving to God.

name: Nehemiah 12:47
text: All Israel in the days of Zerubbabel, and in the days of Nehemiah, gave the portions of the singers and the porters, as every day required: and they set apart that which was for the Levites; and the Levites set apart that which was for the sons of Aaron.

name: Nehemiah 13:1
text: On that day they read in the book of Moses in the audience of the people; and therein was found written, that an Ammonite and a Moabite should not enter into the assembly of God forever,

name: Nehemiah 13:2
text: because they didn"t meet the children of Israel with bread and with water, but hired Balaam against them, to curse them: however our God turned the curse into a blessing.

name: Nehemiah 13:3
text: It came to pass, when they had heard the law, that they separated from Israel all the mixed multitude.

name: Nehemiah 13:4
text: Now before this, Eliashib the priest, who was appointed over the rooms of the house of our God, being allied to Tobiah,

name: Nehemiah 13:5
text: had prepared for him a great room, where before they laid the meal offerings, the frankincense, and the vessels, and the tithes of the grain, the new wine, and the oil, which were given by commandment to the Levites, and the singers, and the porters; and the wave offerings for the priests.

name: Nehemiah 13:6
text: But in all this, I was not at Jerusalem; for in the two and thirtieth year of Artaxerxes king of Babylon I went to the king: and after certain days asked I leave of the king,

name: Nehemiah 13:7
text: and I came to Jerusalem, and understood the evil that Eliashib had done for Tobiah, in preparing him a room in the courts of the house of God.

name: Nehemiah 13:8
text: It grieved me severely: therefore I cast forth all the household stuff of Tobiah out of the room.

name: Nehemiah 13:9
text: Then I commanded, and they cleansed the rooms: and there brought I again the vessels of the house of God, with the meal offerings and the frankincense.

name: Nehemiah 13:10
text: I perceived that the portions of the Levites had not been given them; so that the Levites and the singers, who did the work, had fled everyone to his field.

name: Nehemiah 13:11
text: Then I contended with the rulers, and said, "Why is the house of God forsaken?" I gathered them together, and set them in their place.

name: Nehemiah 13:12
text: Then brought all Judah the tithe of the grain and the new wine and the oil to the treasuries.

name: Nehemiah 13:13
text: I made treasurers over the treasuries, Shelemiah the priest, and Zadok the scribe, and of the Levites, Pedaiah: and next to them was Hanan the son of Zaccur, the son of Mattaniah; for they were counted faithful, and their business was to distribute to their brothers.

name: Nehemiah 13:14
text: Remember me, my God, concerning this, and don"t wipe out my good deeds that I have done for the house of my God, and for its observances.

name: Nehemiah 13:15
text: In those days saw I in Judah some men treading winepresses on the Sabbath, and bringing in sheaves, and loading donkeys; as also wine, grapes, and figs, and all kinds of burdens, which they brought into Jerusalem on the Sabbath day: and I testified against them in the day in which they sold food.

name: Nehemiah 13:16
text: There lived men of Tyre also therein, who brought in fish, and all kinds of wares, and sold on the Sabbath to the children of Judah, and in Jerusalem.

name: Nehemiah 13:17
text: Then I contended with the nobles of Judah, and said to them, "What evil thing is this that you do, and profane the Sabbath day?

name: Nehemiah 13:18
text: Didn"t your fathers do thus, and didn"t our God bring all this evil on us, and on this city? Yet you bring more wrath on Israel by profaning the Sabbath."

name: Nehemiah 13:19
text: It came to pass that, when the gates of Jerusalem began to be dark before the Sabbath, I commanded that the doors should be shut, and commanded that they should not be opened until after the Sabbath. I set some of my servants over the gates, that no burden should be brought in on the Sabbath day.

name: Nehemiah 13:20
text: So the merchants and sellers of all kinds of wares lodged outside of Jerusalem once or twice.

name: Nehemiah 13:21
text: Then I testified against them, and said to them, "Why do you stay around the wall? If you do so again, I will lay hands on you." From that time on, they didn"t come on the Sabbath.

name: Nehemiah 13:22
text: I commanded the Levites that they should purify themselves, and that they should come and keep the gates, to sanctify the Sabbath day. Remember to me, my God, this also, and spare me according to the greatness of your loving kindness.

name: Nehemiah 13:23
text: In those days also saw I the Jews who had married women of Ashdod, of Ammon, and of Moab:

name: Nehemiah 13:24
text: and their children spoke half in the speech of Ashdod, and could not speak in the Jews" language, but according to the language of each people.

name: Nehemiah 13:25
text: I contended with them, and cursed them, and struck certain of them, and plucked off their hair, and made them swear by God, "You shall not give your daughters to their sons, nor take their daughters for your sons, or for yourselves.

name: Nehemiah 13:26
text: Didn"t Solomon king of Israel sin by these things? Yet among many nations was there no king like him, and he was beloved of his God, and God made him king over all Israel. Nevertheless foreign women caused even him to sin.

name: Nehemiah 13:27
text: Shall we then listen to you to do all this great evil, to trespass against our God in marrying foreign women?"

name: Nehemiah 13:28
text: One of the sons of Joiada, the son of Eliashib the high priest, was son-in-law to Sanballat the Horonite: therefore I chased him from me.

name: Nehemiah 13:29
text: Remember them, my God, because they have defiled the priesthood, and the covenant of the priesthood, and of the Levites.

name: Nehemiah 13:30
text: Thus I cleansed them from all foreigners, and appointed duties for the priests and for the Levites, everyone in his work;

name: Nehemiah 13:31
text: and for the wood offering, at times appointed, and for the first fruits. Remember me, my God, for good.

name: Esther 1:1
text: Now it happened in the days of Ahasuerus (this is Ahasuerus who reigned from India even to Ethiopia, over one hundred twenty-seven provinces),

name: Esther 1:2
text: that in those days, when the King Ahasuerus sat on the throne of his kingdom, which was in Shushan the palace,

name: Esther 1:3
text: in the third year of his reign, he made a feast for all his princes and his servants; the power of Persia and Media, the nobles and princes of the provinces, being before him.

name: Esther 1:4
text: He displayed the riches of his glorious kingdom and the honor of his excellent majesty many days, even one hundred eighty days.

name: Esther 1:5
text: When these days were fulfilled, the king made a seven day feast for all the people who were present in Shushan the palace, both great and small, in the court of the garden of the king"s palace.

name: Esther 1:6
text: There were hangings of white, green, and blue material, fastened with cords of fine linen and purple to silver rings and marble pillars. The couches were of gold and silver, on a pavement of red, white, yellow, and black marble.

name: Esther 1:7
text: They gave them drinks in golden vessels of various kinds, including royal wine in abundance, according to the bounty of the king.

name: Esther 1:8
text: In accordance with the law, the drinking was not compulsory; for so the king had instructed all the officials of his house, that they should do according to every man"s pleasure.

name: Esther 1:9
text: Also Vashti the queen made a feast for the women in the royal house which belonged to King Ahasuerus.

name: Esther 1:10
text: On the seventh day, when the heart of the king was merry with wine, he commanded Mehuman, Biztha, Harbona, Bigtha, and Abagtha, Zethar, and Carcass, the seven eunuchs who served in the presence of Ahasuerus the king,

name: Esther 1:11
text: to bring Vashti the queen before the king with the royal crown, to show the people and the princes her beauty; for she was beautiful.

name: Esther 1:12
text: But the queen Vashti refused to come at the king"s commandment by the eunuchs. Therefore the king was very angry, and his anger burned in him.

name: Esther 1:13
text: Then the king said to the wise men, who knew the times, (for it was the king"s custom to consult those who knew law and judgment;

name: Esther 1:14
text: and the next to him were Carshena, Shethar, Admatha, Tarshish, Meres, Marsena, and Memucan, the seven princes of Persia and Media, who saw the king"s face, and sat first in the kingdom),

name: Esther 1:15
text: "What shall we do to the queen Vashti according to law, because she has not done the bidding of the King Ahasuerus by the eunuchs?"

name: Esther 1:16
text: Memucan answered before the king and the princes, "Vashti the queen has not done wrong to just the king, but also to all the princes, and to all the people who are in all the provinces of the King Ahasuerus.

name: Esther 1:17
text: For this deed of the queen will become known to all women, causing them to show contempt for their husbands, when it is reported, "King Ahasuerus commanded Vashti the queen to be brought in before him, but she didn"t come."

name: Esther 1:18
text: Today, the princesses of Persia and Media who have heard of the queen"s deed will tell all the king"s princes. This will cause much contempt and wrath.

name: Esther 1:19
text: "If it please the king, let a royal commandment go from him, and let it be written among the laws of the Persians and the Medes, so that it cannot be altered, that Vashti may never again come before King Ahasuerus; and let the king give her royal estate to another who is better than she.

name: Esther 1:20
text: When the king"s decree which he shall make is published throughout all his kingdom (for it is great), all the wives will give their husbands honor, both great and small."

name: Esther 1:21
text: This advice pleased the king and the princes, and the king did according to the word of Memucan:

name: Esther 1:22
text: for he sent letters into all the king"s provinces, into every province according to its writing, and to every people in their language, that every man should rule his own house, speaking in the language of his own people.

name: Esther 2:1
text: After these things, when the wrath of King Ahasuerus was pacified, he remembered Vashti, and what she had done, and what was decreed against her.

name: Esther 2:2
text: Then the king"s servants who served him said, "Let beautiful young virgins be sought for the king.

name: Esther 2:3
text: Let the king appoint officers in all the provinces of his kingdom, that they may gather together all the beautiful young virgins to the citadel of Susa, to the women"s house, to the custody of Hegai the king"s eunuch, keeper of the women. Let cosmetics be given them;

name: Esther 2:4
text: and let the maiden who pleases the king be queen instead of Vashti." The thing pleased the king, and he did so.

name: Esther 2:5
text: There was a certain Jew in the citadel of Susa, whose name was Mordecai, the son of Jair, the son of Shimei, the son of Kish, a Benjamite,

name: Esther 2:6
text: who had been carried away from Jerusalem with the captives who had been carried away with Jeconiah king of Judah, whom Nebuchadnezzar the king of Babylon had carried away.

name: Esther 2:7
text: He brought up Hadassah, that is, Esther, his uncle"s daughter; for she had neither father nor mother. The maiden was fair and beautiful; and when her father and mother were dead, Mordecai took her for his own daughter.

name: Esther 2:8
text: So it happened, when the king"s commandment and his decree was heard, and when many maidens were gathered together to the citadel of Susa, to the custody of Hegai, that Esther was taken into the king"s house, to the custody of Hegai, keeper of the women.

name: Esther 2:9
text: The maiden pleased him, and she obtained kindness from him. He quickly gave her cosmetics and her portions of food, and the seven choice maidens who were to be given her out of the king"s house. He moved her and her maidens to the best place in the women"s house.

name: Esther 2:10
text: Esther had not made known her people nor her relatives, because Mordecai had instructed her that she should not make it known.

name: Esther 2:11
text: Mordecai walked every day in front of the court of the women"s house, to find out how Esther was doing, and what would become of her.

name: Esther 2:12
text: Each young woman"s turn came to go in to King Ahasuerus after her purification for twelve months (for so were the days of their purification accomplished, six months with oil of myrrh, and six months with sweet fragrances and with preparations for beautifying women).

name: Esther 2:13
text: The young woman then came to the king like this: whatever she desired was given her to go with her out of the women"s house to the king"s house.

name: Esther 2:14
text: In the evening she went, and on the next day she returned into the second women"s house, to the custody of Shaashgaz, the king"s eunuch, who kept the concubines. She came in to the king no more, unless the king delighted in her, and she was called by name.

name: Esther 2:15
text: Now when the turn of Esther, the daughter of Abihail the uncle of Mordecai, who had taken her for his daughter, came to go in to the king, she required nothing but what Hegai the king"s eunuch, the keeper of the women, advised. Esther obtained favor in the sight of all those who looked at her.

name: Esther 2:16
text: So Esther was taken to King Ahasuerus into his royal house in the tenth month, which is the month Tebeth, in the seventh year of his reign.

name: Esther 2:17
text: The king loved Esther more than all the women, and she obtained favor and kindness in his sight more than all the virgins; so that he set the royal crown on her head, and made her queen instead of Vashti.

name: Esther 2:18
text: Then the king made a great feast for all his princes and his servants, even Esther"s feast; and he proclaimed a holiday in the provinces, and gave gifts according to the king"s bounty.

name: Esther 2:19
text: When the virgins were gathered together the second time, Mordecai was sitting in the king"s gate.

name: Esther 2:20
text: Esther had not yet made known her relatives nor her people, as Mordecai had commanded her; for Esther obeyed Mordecai, like she did when she was brought up by him.

name: Esther 2:21
text: In those days, while Mordecai was sitting in the king"s gate, two of the king"s eunuchs, Bigthan and Teresh, who were doorkeepers, were angry, and sought to lay hands on the King Ahasuerus.

name: Esther 2:22
text: This thing became known to Mordecai, who informed Esther the queen; and Esther informed the king in Mordecai"s name.

name: Esther 2:23
text: When this matter was investigated, and it was found to be so, they were both hanged on a tree; and it was written in the book of the chronicles in the king"s presence.

name: Esther 3:1
text: After these things King Ahasuerus promoted Haman the son of Hammedatha the Agagite, and advanced him, and set his seat above all the princes who were with him.

name: Esther 3:2
text: All the king"s servants who were in the king"s gate bowed down, and paid homage to Haman; for the king had so commanded concerning him. But Mordecai didn"t bow down or pay him homage.

name: Esther 3:3
text: Then the king"s servants, who were in the king"s gate, said to Mordecai, "Why do you disobey the king"s commandment?"

name: Esther 3:4
text: Now it came to pass, when they spoke daily to him, and he didn"t listen to them, that they told Haman, to see whether Mordecai"s reason would stand; for he had told them that he was a Jew.

name: Esther 3:5
text: When Haman saw that Mordecai didn"t bow down, nor pay him homage, Haman was full of wrath.

name: Esther 3:6
text: But he scorned the thought of laying hands on Mordecai alone, for they had made known to him Mordecai"s people. Therefore Haman sought to destroy all the Jews who were throughout the whole kingdom of Ahasuerus, even Mordecai"s people.

name: Esther 3:7
text: In the first month, which is the month Nisan, in the twelfth year of King Ahasuerus, they cast Pur, that is, the lot, before Haman from day to day, and from month to month, and chose the twelfth month, which is the month Adar.

name: Esther 3:8
text: Haman said to King Ahasuerus, "There is a certain people scattered abroad and dispersed among the peoples in all the provinces of your kingdom, and their laws are different than other people"s. They don"t keep the king"s laws. Therefore it is not for the king"s profit to allow them to remain.

name: Esther 3:9
text: If it pleases the king, let it be written that they be destroyed; and I will pay ten thousand talents of silver into the hands of those who are in charge of the king"s business, to bring it into the king"s treasuries."

name: Esther 3:10
text: The king took his ring from his hand, and gave it to Haman the son of Hammedatha the Agagite, the Jews" enemy.

name: Esther 3:11
text: The king said to Haman, "The silver is given to you, the people also, to do with them as it seems good to you."

name: Esther 3:12
text: Then the king"s scribes were called in on the first month, on the thirteenth day of the month; and all that Haman commanded was written to the king"s satraps, and to the governors who were over every province, and to the princes of every people, to every province according its writing, and to every people in their language. It was written in the name of King Ahasuerus, and it was sealed with the king"s ring.

name: Esther 3:13
text: Letters were sent by couriers into all the king"s provinces, to destroy, to kill, and to cause to perish, all Jews, both young and old, little children and women, in one day, even on the thirteenth day of the twelfth month, which is the month Adar, and to plunder their possessions.

name: Esther 3:14
text: A copy of the letter, that the decree should be given out in every province, was published to all the peoples, that they should be ready against that day.

name: Esther 3:15
text: The couriers went forth in haste by the king"s commandment, and the decree was given out in the citadel of Susa. The king and Haman sat down to drink; but the city of Shushan was perplexed.

name: Esther 4:1
text: Now when Mordecai found out all that was done, Mordecai tore his clothes, and put on sackcloth with ashes, and went out into the midst of the city, and wailed loudly and a bitterly.

name: Esther 4:2
text: He came even before the king"s gate, for no one is allowed inside the king"s gate clothed with sackcloth.

name: Esther 4:3
text: In every province, wherever the king"s commandment and his decree came, there was great mourning among the Jews, and fasting, and weeping, and wailing; and many lay in sackcloth and ashes.

name: Esther 4:4
text: Esther"s maidens and her eunuchs came and told her this, and the queen was exceedingly grieved. She sent clothing to Mordecai, to replace his sackcloth; but he didn"t receive it.

name: Esther 4:5
text: Then Esther called for Hathach, one of the king"s eunuchs, whom he had appointed to attend her, and commanded him to go to Mordecai, to find out what this was, and why it was.

name: Esther 4:6
text: So Hathach went out to Mordecai, to city square which was before the king"s gate.

name: Esther 4:7
text: Mordecai told him of all that had happened to him, and the exact sum of the money that Haman had promised to pay to the king"s treasuries for the destruction of the Jews.

name: Esther 4:8
text: He also gave him the copy of the writing of the decree that was given out in Shushan to destroy them, to show it to Esther, and to declare it to her, and to urge her to go in to the king, to make supplication to him, and to make request before him, for her people.

name: Esther 4:9
text: Hathach came and told Esther the words of Mordecai.

name: Esther 4:10
text: Then Esther spoke to Hathach, and gave him a message to Mordecai:

name: Esther 4:11
text: "All the king"s servants, and the people of the king"s provinces, know, that whoever, whether man or woman, comes to the king into the inner court without being called, there is one law for him, that he be put to death, except those to whom the king might hold out the golden scepter, that he may live. I have not been called to come in to the king these thirty days."

name: Esther 4:12
text: They told to Mordecai Esther"s words.

name: Esther 4:13
text: Then Mordecai asked them return answer to Esther, "Don"t think to yourself that you will escape in the king"s house any more than all the Jews.

name: Esther 4:14
text: For if you remain silent now, then relief and deliverance will come to the Jews from another place, but you and your father"s house will perish. Who knows if you haven"t come to the kingdom for such a time as this?"

name: Esther 4:15
text: Then Esther asked them to answer Mordecai,

name: Esther 4:16
text: "Go, gather together all the Jews who are present in Shushan, and fast for me, and neither eat nor drink three days, night or day. I and my maidens will also fast the same way. Then I will go in to the king, which is against the law; and if I perish, I perish."

name: Esther 4:17
text: So Mordecai went his way, and did according to all that Esther had commanded him.

name: Esther 5:1
text: Now it happened on the third day that Esther put on her royal clothing, and stood in the inner court of the king"s house, next to the king"s house. The king sat on his royal throne in the royal house, next to the entrance of the house.

name: Esther 5:2
text: When the king saw Esther the queen standing in the court, she obtained favor in his sight; and the king held out to Esther the golden scepter that was in his hand. So Esther came near, and touched the top of the scepter.

name: Esther 5:3
text: Then the king asked her, "What would you like, queen Esther? What is your request? It shall be given you even to the half of the kingdom."

name: Esther 5:4
text: Esther said, "If it seems good to the king, let the king and Haman come today to the banquet that I have prepared for him."

name: Esther 5:5
text: Then the king said, "Bring Haman quickly, so that it may be done as Esther has said." So the king and Haman came to the banquet that Esther had prepared.

name: Esther 5:6
text: The king said to Esther at the banquet of wine, "What is your petition? It shall be granted you. What is your request? Even to the half of the kingdom it shall be performed."

name: Esther 5:7
text: Then Esther answered and said, "My petition and my request is this.

name: Esther 5:8
text: If I have found favor in the sight of the king, and if it please the king to grant my petition and to perform my request, let the king and Haman come to the banquet that I will prepare for them, and I will do tomorrow as the king has said."

name: Esther 5:9
text: Then Haman went out that day joyful and glad of heart, but when Haman saw Mordecai in the king"s gate, that he didn"t stand up nor move for him, he was filled with wrath against Mordecai.

name: Esther 5:10
text: Nevertheless Haman restrained himself, and went home. There, he sent and called for his friends and Zeresh his wife.

name: Esther 5:11
text: Haman recounted to them the glory of his riches, the multitude of his children, all the things in which the king had promoted him, and how he had advanced him above the princes and servants of the king.

name: Esther 5:12
text: Haman also said, "Yes, Esther the queen let no man come in with the king to the banquet that she had prepared but myself; and tomorrow I am also invited by her together with the king.

name: Esther 5:13
text: Yet all this avails me nothing, so long as I see Mordecai the Jew sitting at the king"s gate."

name: Esther 5:14
text: Then Zeresh his wife and all his friends said to him, "Let a gallows be made fifty cubits high, and in the morning speak to the king about hanging Mordecai on it. Then go in merrily with the king to the banquet." This pleased Haman, so he had the gallows made.

name: Esther 6:1
text: On that night, the king couldn"t sleep. He commanded the book of records of the chronicles to be brought, and they were read to the king.

name: Esther 6:2
text: It was found written that Mordecai had told of Bigthana and Teresh, two of the king"s eunuchs, who were doorkeepers, who had tried to lay hands on the King Ahasuerus.

name: Esther 6:3
text: The king said, "What honor and dignity has been bestowed on Mordecai for this?" Then the king"s servants who attended him said, "Nothing has been done for him."

name: Esther 6:4
text: The king said, "Who is in the court?" Now Haman had come into the outer court of the king"s house, to speak to the king about hanging Mordecai on the gallows that he had prepared for him.

name: Esther 6:5
text: The king"s servants said to him, "Behold, Haman stands in the court." The king said, "Let him come in."

name: Esther 6:6
text: So Haman came in. The king said to him, "What shall be done to the man whom the king delights to honor?" Now Haman said in his heart, "Who would the king delight to honor more than myself?"

name: Esther 6:7
text: Haman said to the king, "For the man whom the king delights to honor,

name: Esther 6:8
text: let royal clothing be brought which the king uses to wear, and the horse that the king rides on, and on the head of which a crown royal is set.

name: Esther 6:9
text: Let the clothing and the horse be delivered to the hand of one of the king"s most noble princes, that they may array the man whom the king delights to honor with them, and have him ride on horseback through the city square, and proclaim before him, "Thus shall it be done to the man whom the king delights to honor!""

name: Esther 6:10
text: Then the king said to Haman, "Hurry and take the clothing and the horse, as you have said, and do this for Mordecai the Jew, who sits at the king"s gate. Let nothing fail of all that you have spoken."

name: Esther 6:11
text: Then Haman took the clothing and the horse, and arrayed Mordecai, and had him ride through the city square, and proclaimed before him, "Thus shall it be done to the man whom the king delights to honor!"

name: Esther 6:12
text: Mordecai came back to the king"s gate, but Haman hurried to his house, mourning and having his head covered.

name: Esther 6:13
text: Haman recounted to Zeresh his wife and all his friends everything that had happened to him. Then his wise men and Zeresh his wife said to him, "If Mordecai, before whom you have begun to fall, is of Jewish descent, you will not prevail against him, but you will surely fall before him."

name: Esther 6:14
text: While they were yet talking with him, the king"s eunuchs came, and hurried to bring Haman to the banquet that Esther had prepared.

name: Esther 7:1
text: So the king and Haman came to banquet with Esther the queen.

name: Esther 7:2
text: The king said again to Esther on the second day at the banquet of wine, "What is your petition, queen Esther? It shall be granted you. What is your request? Even to the half of the kingdom it shall be performed."

name: Esther 7:3
text: Then Esther the queen answered, "If I have found favor in your sight, O king, and if it please the king, let my life be given me at my petition, and my people at my request.

name: Esther 7:4
text: For we are sold, I and my people, to be destroyed, to be slain, and to perish. But if we had been sold for bondservants and bondmaids, I would have held my peace, although the adversary could not have compensated for the king"s loss."

name: Esther 7:5
text: Then King Ahasuerus said to Esther the queen, "Who is he, and where is he who dared presume in his heart to do so?"

name: Esther 7:6
text: Esther said, "An adversary and an enemy, even this wicked Haman!" Then Haman was afraid before the king and the queen.

name: Esther 7:7
text: The king arose in his wrath from the banquet of wine and went into the palace garden. Haman stood up to make request for his life to Esther the queen; for he saw that there was evil determined against him by the king.

name: Esther 7:8
text: Then the king returned out of the palace garden into the place of the banquet of wine; and Haman had fallen on the couch where Esther was. Then the king said, "Will he even assault the queen in front of me in the house?" As the word went out of the king"s mouth, they covered Haman"s face.

name: Esther 7:9
text: Then Harbonah, one of the eunuchs who were with the king said, "Behold, the gallows fifty cubits high, which Haman has made for Mordecai, who spoke good for the king, is standing at Haman"s house." The king said, "Hang him on it!"

name: Esther 7:10
text: So they hanged Haman on the gallows that he had prepared for Mordecai. Then was the king"s wrath pacified.

name: Esther 8:1
text: On that day, King Ahasuerus gave the house of Haman, the Jews" enemy, to Esther the queen. Mordecai came before the king; for Esther had told what he was to her.

name: Esther 8:2
text: The king took off his ring, which he had taken from Haman, and gave it to Mordecai. Esther set Mordecai over the house of Haman.

name: Esther 8:3
text: Esther spoke yet again before the king, and fell down at his feet, and begged him with tears to put away the mischief of Haman the Agagite, and his device that he had devised against the Jews.

name: Esther 8:4
text: Then the king held out to Esther the golden scepter. So Esther arose, and stood before the king.

name: Esther 8:5
text: She said, "If it pleases the king, and if I have found favor in his sight, and the thing seem right to the king, and I am pleasing in his eyes, let it be written to reverse the letters devised by Haman, the son of Hammedatha the Agagite, which he wrote to destroy the Jews who are in all the king"s provinces.

name: Esther 8:6
text: For how can I endure to see the evil that would come to my people? How can I endure to see the destruction of my relatives?"

name: Esther 8:7
text: Then King Ahasuerus said to Esther the queen and to Mordecai the Jew, "See, I have given Esther the house of Haman, and him they have hanged on the gallows, because he laid his hand on the Jews.

name: Esther 8:8
text: Write also to the Jews, as it pleases you, in the king"s name, and seal it with the king"s ring; for the writing which is written in the king"s name, and sealed with the king"s ring, may not be reversed by any man."

name: Esther 8:9
text: Then the king"s scribes were called at that time, in the third month Sivan, on the twenty-third day of the month; and it was written according to all that Mordecai commanded to the Jews, and to the satraps, and the governors and princes of the provinces which are from India to Ethiopia, one hundred twenty-seven provinces, to every province according to its writing, and to every people in their language, and to the Jews in their writing, and in their language.

name: Esther 8:10
text: He wrote in the name of King Ahasuerus, and sealed it with the king"s ring, and sent letters by courier on horseback, riding on royal horses that were bread from swift steeds.

name: Esther 8:11
text: In those letters, the king granted the Jews who were in every city to gather themselves together, and to defend their life, to destroy, to kill, and to cause to perish, all the power of the people and province that would assault them, their little ones and women, and to plunder their possessions,

name: Esther 8:12
text: on one day in all the provinces of King Ahasuerus, on the thirteenth day of the twelfth month, which is the month Adar.

name: Esther 8:13
text: A copy of the letter, that the decree should be given out in every province, was published to all the peoples, that the Jews should be ready for that day to avenge themselves on their enemies.

name: Esther 8:14
text: So the couriers who rode on royal horses went out, hastened and pressed on by the king"s commandment. The decree was given out in the citadel of Susa.

name: Esther 8:15
text: Mordecai went out of the presence of the king in royal clothing of blue and white, and with a great crown of gold, and with a robe of fine linen and purple; and the city of Susa shouted and was glad.

name: Esther 8:16
text: The Jews had light, gladness, joy, and honor.

name: Esther 8:17
text: In every province, and in every city, wherever the king"s commandment and his decree came, the Jews had gladness, joy, a feast, and a good day. Many from among the peoples of the land became Jews; for the fear of the Jews was fallen on them.

name: Esther 9:1
text: Now in the twelfth month, which is the month Adar, on the thirteenth day of the month, when the king"s commandment and his decree drew near to be put in execution, on the day that the enemies of the Jews hoped to conquer them, (but it was turned out the opposite happened, that the Jews conquered those who hated them),

name: Esther 9:2
text: the Jews gathered themselves together in their cities throughout all the provinces of the King Ahasuerus, to lay hands on those who wanted to harm them. No one could withstand them, because the fear of them had fallen on all the people.

name: Esther 9:3
text: All the princes of the provinces, the satraps, the governors, and those who did the king"s business helped the Jews, because the fear of Mordecai had fallen on them.

name: Esther 9:4
text: For Mordecai was great in the king"s house, and his fame went out throughout all the provinces; for the man Mordecai grew greater and greater.

name: Esther 9:5
text: The Jews struck all their enemies with the stroke of the sword, and with slaughter and destruction, and did what they wanted to those who hated them.

name: Esther 9:6
text: In the citadel of Susa, the Jews killed and destroyed five hundred men.

name: Esther 9:7
text: They killed Parshandatha, Dalphon, Aspatha,

name: Esther 9:8
text: Poratha, Adalia, Aridatha,

name: Esther 9:9
text: Parmashta, Arisai, Aridai, and Vaizatha,

name: Esther 9:10
text: the ten sons of Haman the son of Hammedatha, the Jew"s enemy, but they didn"t lay their hand on the plunder.

name: Esther 9:11
text: On that day, the number of those who were slain in the citadel of Susa was brought before the king.

name: Esther 9:12
text: The king said to Esther the queen, "The Jews have slain and destroyed five hundred men in the citadel of Susa, including the ten sons of Haman; what then have they done in the rest of the king"s provinces! Now what is your petition? It shall be granted you. What is your further request? It shall be done."

name: Esther 9:13
text: Then Esther said, "If it pleases the king, let it be granted to the Jews who are in Shushan to do tomorrow also according to this day"s decree, and let Haman"s ten sons be hanged on the gallows."

name: Esther 9:14
text: The king commanded this to be done. A decree was given out in Shushan; and they hanged Haman"s ten sons.

name: Esther 9:15
text: The Jews who were in Shushan gathered themselves together on the fourteenth day also of the month Adar, and killed three hundred men in Shushan; but they didn"t lay their hand on the spoil.

name: Esther 9:16
text: The other Jews who were in the king"s provinces gathered themselves together, defended their lives, had rest from their enemies, and killed seventy-five thousand of those who hated them; but they didn"t lay their hand on the plunder.

name: Esther 9:17
text: This was done on the thirteenth day of the month Adar; and on the fourteenth day of that month they rested and made it a day of feasting and gladness.

name: Esther 9:18
text: But the Jews who were in Shushan assembled together on the thirteenth and on the fourteenth days of the month; and on the fifteenth day of that month, they rested, and made it a day of feasting and gladness.

name: Esther 9:19
text: Therefore the Jews of the villages, who live in the unwalled towns, make the fourteenth day of the month Adar a day of gladness and feasting, a good day, and a day of sending presents of food to one another.

name: Esther 9:20
text: Mordecai wrote these things, and sent letters to all the Jews who were in all the provinces of the king Ahasuerus, both near and far,

name: Esther 9:21
text: to enjoin them that they should keep the fourteenth and fifteenth days of the month Adar yearly,

name: Esther 9:22
text: as the days in which the Jews had rest from their enemies, and the month which was turned to them from sorrow to gladness, and from mourning into a good day; that they should make them days of feasting and gladness, and of sending presents of food to one another, and gifts to the needy.

name: Esther 9:23
text: The Jews accepted the custom that they had begun, as Mordecai had written to them;

name: Esther 9:24
text: because Haman the son of Hammedatha, the Agagite, the enemy of all the Jews, had plotted against the Jews to destroy them, and had cast "Pur," that is the lot, to consume them, and to destroy them;

name: Esther 9:25
text: but when this became known to the king, he commanded by letters that his wicked device, which he had devised against the Jews, should return on his own head, and that he and his sons should be hanged on the gallows.

name: Esther 9:26
text: Therefore they called these days "Purim," from the word "Pur." Therefore because of all the words of this letter, and of that which they had seen concerning this matter, and that which had come to them,

name: Esther 9:27
text: the Jews established, and imposed on themselves, and on their descendants, and on all those who joined themselves to them, so that it should not fail, that they would keep these two days according to what was written, and according to its appointed time, every year;

name: Esther 9:28
text: and that these days should be remembered and kept throughout every generation, every family, every province, and every city; and that these days of Purim should not fail from among the Jews, nor their memory perish from their seed.

name: Esther 9:29
text: Then Esther the queen, the daughter of Abihail, and Mordecai the Jew, wrote with all authority to confirm this second letter of Purim.

name: Esther 9:30
text: He sent letters to all the Jews, to the hundred twenty-seven provinces of the kingdom of Ahasuerus, with words of peace and truth,

name: Esther 9:31
text: to confirm these days of Purim in their appointed times, as Mordecai the Jew and Esther the queen had decreed, and as they had imposed upon themselves and their descendants, in the matter of the fastings and their cry.

name: Esther 9:32
text: The commandment of Esther confirmed these matters of Purim; and it was written in the book.

name: Esther 10:1
text: King Ahasuerus laid a tribute on the land, and on the islands of the sea.

name: Esther 10:2
text: All the acts of his power and of his might, and the full account of the greatness of Mordecai, to which the king advanced him, aren"t they written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Media and Persia?

name: Esther 10:3
text: For Mordecai the Jew was next to King Ahasuerus, and great among the Jews, and accepted by the multitude of his brothers, seeking the good of his people, and speaking peace to all his descendants.

name: Job 1:1
text: There was a man in the land of Uz, whose name was Job. That man was blameless and upright, and one who feared God, and turned away from evil.

name: Job 1:2
text: There were born to him seven sons and three daughters.

name: Job 1:3
text: His possessions also were seven thousand sheep, three thousand camels, five hundred yoke of oxen, five hundred female donkeys, and a very great household; so that this man was the greatest of all the children of the east.

name: Job 1:4
text: His sons went and held a feast in the house of each one on his birthday; and they sent and called for their three sisters to eat and to drink with them.

name: Job 1:5
text: It was so, when the days of their feasting had run their course, that Job sent and sanctified them, and rose up early in the morning, and offered burnt offerings according to the number of them all. For Job said, "It may be that my sons have sinned, and renounced God in their hearts." Job did so continually.

name: Job 1:6
text: Now it happened on the day when God"s sons came to present themselves before Yahweh, that Satan also came among them.

name: Job 1:7
text: Yahweh said to Satan, "Where have you come from?" Then Satan answered Yahweh, and said, "From going back and forth in the earth, and from walking up and down in it."

name: Job 1:8
text: Yahweh said to Satan, "Have you considered my servant, Job? For there is none like him in the earth, a blameless and an upright man, one who fears God, and turns away from evil."

name: Job 1:9
text: Then Satan answered Yahweh, and said, "Does Job fear God for nothing?

name: Job 1:10
text: Haven"t you made a hedge around him, and around his house, and around all that he has, on every side? You have blessed the work of his hands, and his substance is increased in the land.

name: Job 1:11
text: But put forth your hand now, and touch all that he has, and he will renounce you to your face."

name: Job 1:12
text: Yahweh said to Satan, "Behold, all that he has is in your power. Only on himself don"t put forth your hand." So Satan went forth from the presence of Yahweh.

name: Job 1:13
text: It fell on a day when his sons and his daughters were eating and drinking wine in their eldest brother"s house,

name: Job 1:14
text: that there came a messenger to Job, and said, "The oxen were plowing, and the donkeys feeding beside them,

name: Job 1:15
text: and the Sabeans attacked, and took them away. Yes, they have killed the servants with the edge of the sword, and I alone have escaped to tell you."

name: Job 1:16
text: While he was still speaking, there also came another, and said, "The fire of God has fallen from the sky, and has burned up the sheep and the servants, and consumed them, and I alone have escaped to tell you."

name: Job 1:17
text: While he was still speaking, there came also another, and said, "The Chaldeans made three bands, and swept down on the camels, and have taken them away, yes, and killed the servants with the edge of the sword; and I alone have escaped to tell you."

name: Job 1:18
text: While he was still speaking, there came also another, and said, "Your sons and your daughters were eating and drinking wine in their eldest brother"s house,

name: Job 1:19
text: and behold, there came a great wind from the wilderness, and struck the four corners of the house, and it fell on the young men, and they are dead. I alone have escaped to tell you."

name: Job 1:20
text: Then Job arose, and tore his robe, and shaved his head, and fell down on the ground, and worshiped.

name: Job 1:21
text: He said, "Naked I came out of my mother"s womb, and naked shall I return there. Yahweh gave, and Yahweh has taken away. Blessed be the name of Yahweh."

name: Job 1:22
text: In all this, Job did not sin, nor charge God with wrongdoing.

name: Job 2:1
text: Again it happened on the day when the God"s sons came to present themselves before Yahweh, that Satan came also among them to present himself before Yahweh.

name: Job 2:2
text: Yahweh said to Satan, "Where have you come from?" Satan answered Yahweh, and said, "From going back and forth in the earth, and from walking up and down in it."

name: Job 2:3
text: Yahweh said to Satan, "Have you considered my servant Job? For there is none like him in the earth, a blameless and an upright man, one who fears God, and turns away from evil. He still maintains his integrity, although you incited me against him, to ruin him without cause."

name: Job 2:4
text: Satan answered Yahweh, and said, "Skin for skin. Yes, all that a man has he will give for his life.

name: Job 2:5
text: But put forth your hand now, and touch his bone and his flesh, and he will renounce you to your face."

name: Job 2:6
text: Yahweh said to Satan, "Behold, he is in your hand. Only spare his life."

name: Job 2:7
text: So Satan went forth from the presence of Yahweh, and struck Job with painful sores from the sole of his foot to his head.

name: Job 2:8
text: He took for himself a potsherd to scrape himself with, and he sat among the ashes.

name: Job 2:9
text: Then his wife said to him, "Do you still maintain your integrity? Renounce God, and die."

name: Job 2:10
text: But he said to her, "You speak as one of the foolish women would speak. What? Shall we receive good at the hand of God, and shall we not receive evil?" In all this Job didn"t sin with his lips.

name: Job 2:11
text: Now when Job"s three friends heard of all this evil that had come on him, they each came from his own place: Eliphaz the Temanite, Bildad the Shuhite, and Zophar the Naamathite, and they made an appointment together to come to sympathize with him and to comfort him.

name: Job 2:12
text: When they lifted up their eyes from a distance, and didn"t recognize him, they raised their voices, and wept; and they each tore his robe, and sprinkled dust on their heads toward the sky.

name: Job 2:13
text: So they sat down with him on the ground seven days and seven nights, and none spoke a word to him, for they saw that his grief was very great.

name: Job 3:1
text: After this Job opened his mouth, and cursed the day of his birth.

name: Job 3:2
text: Job answered:

name: Job 3:3
text: "Let the day perish in which I was born, the night which said, "There is a boy conceived."

name: Job 3:4
text: Let that day be darkness. Don"t let God from above seek for it, neither let the light shine on it.

name: Job 3:5
text: Let darkness and the shadow of death claim it for their own. Let a cloud dwell on it. Let all that makes black the day terrify it.

name: Job 3:6
text: As for that night, let thick darkness seize on it. Let it not rejoice among the days of the year. Let it not come into the number of the months.

name: Job 3:7
text: Behold, let that night be barren. Let no joyful voice come therein.

name: Job 3:8
text: Let them curse it who curse the day, who are ready to rouse up leviathan.

name: Job 3:9
text: Let the stars of its twilight be dark. Let it look for light, but have none, neither let it see the eyelids of the morning,

name: Job 3:10
text: because it didn"t shut up the doors of my mother"s womb, nor did it hide trouble from my eyes.

name: Job 3:11
text: "Why didn"t I die from the womb? Why didn"t I give up the spirit when my mother bore me?

name: Job 3:12
text: Why did the knees receive me? Or why the breast, that I should nurse?

name: Job 3:13
text: For now should I have lain down and been quiet. I should have slept, then I would have been at rest,

name: Job 3:14
text: with kings and counselors of the earth, who built up waste places for themselves;

name: Job 3:15
text: or with princes who had gold, who filled their houses with silver:

name: Job 3:16
text: or as a hidden untimely birth I had not been, as infants who never saw light.

name: Job 3:17
text: There the wicked cease from troubling. There the weary are at rest.

name: Job 3:18
text: There the prisoners are at ease together. They don"t hear the voice of the taskmaster.

name: Job 3:19
text: The small and the great are there. The servant is free from his master.

name: Job 3:20
text: "Why is light given to him who is in misery, life to the bitter in soul,

name: Job 3:21
text: Who long for death, but it doesn"t come; and dig for it more than for hidden treasures,

name: Job 3:22
text: who rejoice exceedingly, and are glad, when they can find the grave?

name: Job 3:23
text: Why is light given to a man whose way is hidden, whom God has hedged in?

name: Job 3:24
text: For my sighing comes before I eat. My groanings are poured out like water.

name: Job 3:25
text: For the thing which I fear comes on me, That which I am afraid of comes to me.

name: Job 3:26
text: I am not at ease, neither am I quiet, neither have I rest; but trouble comes."

name: Job 4:1
text: Then Eliphaz the Temanite answered,

name: Job 4:2
text: "If someone ventures to talk with you, will you be grieved? But who can withhold himself from speaking?

name: Job 4:3
text: Behold, you have instructed many, you have strengthened the weak hands.

name: Job 4:4
text: Your words have supported him who was falling, You have made firm the feeble knees.

name: Job 4:5
text: But now it has come to you, and you faint. It touches you, and you are troubled.

name: Job 4:6
text: Isn"t your piety your confidence? Isn"t the integrity of your ways your hope?

name: Job 4:7
text: "Remember, now, whoever perished, being innocent? Or where were the upright cut off?

name: Job 4:8
text: According to what I have seen, those who plow iniquity, and sow trouble, reap the same.

name: Job 4:9
text: By the breath of God they perish. By the blast of his anger are they consumed.

name: Job 4:10
text: The roaring of the lion, and the voice of the fierce lion, the teeth of the young lions, are broken.

name: Job 4:11
text: The old lion perishes for lack of prey. The cubs of the lioness are scattered abroad.

name: Job 4:12
text: "Now a thing was secretly brought to me. My ear received a whisper of it.

name: Job 4:13
text: In thoughts from the visions of the night, when deep sleep falls on men,

name: Job 4:14
text: fear came on me, and trembling, which made all my bones shake.

name: Job 4:15
text: Then a spirit passed before my face. The hair of my flesh stood up.

name: Job 4:16
text: It stood still, but I couldn"t discern its appearance. A form was before my eyes. Silence, then I heard a voice, saying,

name: Job 4:17
text: "Shall mortal man be more just than God? Shall a man be more pure than his Maker?

name: Job 4:18
text: Behold, he puts no trust in his servants. He charges his angels with error.

name: Job 4:19
text: How much more, those who dwell in houses of clay, whose foundation is in the dust, who are crushed before the moth!

name: Job 4:20
text: Between morning and evening they are destroyed. They perish forever without any regarding it.

name: Job 4:21
text: Isn"t their tent cord plucked up within them? They die, and that without wisdom."

name: Job 5:1
text: "Call now; is there any who will answer you? To which of the holy ones will you turn?

name: Job 5:2
text: For resentment kills the foolish man, and jealousy kills the simple.

name: Job 5:3
text: I have seen the foolish taking root, but suddenly I cursed his habitation.

name: Job 5:4
text: His children are far from safety. They are crushed in the gate. Neither is there any to deliver them,

name: Job 5:5
text: whose harvest the hungry eats up, and take it even out of the thorns. The snare gapes for their substance.

name: Job 5:6
text: For affliction doesn"t come forth from the dust, neither does trouble spring out of the ground;

name: Job 5:7
text: but man is born to trouble, as the sparks fly upward.

name: Job 5:8
text: "But as for me, I would seek God. I would commit my cause to God,

name: Job 5:9
text: who does great things that can"t be fathomed, marvelous things without number;

name: Job 5:10
text: who gives rain on the earth, and sends waters on the fields;

name: Job 5:11
text: so that he sets up on high those who are low, those who mourn are exalted to safety.

name: Job 5:12
text: He frustrates the devices of the crafty, So that their hands can"t perform their enterprise.

name: Job 5:13
text: He takes the wise in their own craftiness; the counsel of the cunning is carried headlong.

name: Job 5:14
text: They meet with darkness in the day time, and grope at noonday as in the night.

name: Job 5:15
text: But he saves from the sword of their mouth, even the needy from the hand of the mighty.

name: Job 5:16
text: So the poor has hope, and injustice shuts her mouth.

name: Job 5:17
