text: "Behold, happy is the man whom God corrects. Therefore do not despise the chastening of the Almighty.

name: Job 5:18
text: For he wounds, and binds up. He injures, and his hands make whole.

name: Job 5:19
text: He will deliver you in six troubles; yes, in seven no evil shall touch you.

name: Job 5:20
text: In famine he will redeem you from death; in war, from the power of the sword.

name: Job 5:21
text: You shall be hidden from the scourge of the tongue, neither shall you be afraid of destruction when it comes.

name: Job 5:22
text: At destruction and famine you shall laugh, neither shall you be afraid of the animals of the earth.

name: Job 5:23
text: For you shall be allied with the stones of the field. The animals of the field shall be at peace with you.

name: Job 5:24
text: You shall know that your tent is in peace. You shall visit your fold, and shall miss nothing.

name: Job 5:25
text: You shall know also that your seed shall be great, Your offspring as the grass of the earth.

name: Job 5:26
text: You shall come to your grave in a full age, like a shock of grain comes in its season.

name: Job 5:27
text: Look this, we have searched it, so it is. Hear it, and know it for your good."

name: Job 6:1
text: Then Job answered,

name: Job 6:2
text: "Oh that my anguish were weighed, and all my calamity laid in the balances!

name: Job 6:3
text: For now it would be heavier than the sand of the seas, therefore have my words been rash.

name: Job 6:4
text: For the arrows of the Almighty are within me. My spirit drinks up their poison. The terrors of God set themselves in array against me.

name: Job 6:5
text: Does the wild donkey bray when he has grass? Or does the ox low over his fodder?

name: Job 6:6
text: Can that which has no flavor be eaten without salt? Or is there any taste in the white of an egg?

name: Job 6:7
text: My soul refuses to touch them. They are as loathsome food to me.

name: Job 6:8
text: "Oh that I might have my request, that God would grant the thing that I long for,

name: Job 6:9
text: even that it would please God to crush me; that he would let loose his hand, and cut me off!

name: Job 6:10
text: Be it still my consolation, yes, let me exult in pain that doesn"t spare, that I have not denied the words of the Holy One.

name: Job 6:11
text: What is my strength, that I should wait? What is my end, that I should be patient?

name: Job 6:12
text: Is my strength the strength of stones? Or is my flesh of brass?

name: Job 6:13
text: Isn"t it that I have no help in me, That wisdom is driven quite from me?

name: Job 6:14
text: "To him who is ready to faint, kindness should be shown from his friend; even to him who forsakes the fear of the Almighty.

name: Job 6:15
text: My brothers have dealt deceitfully as a brook, as the channel of brooks that pass away;

name: Job 6:16
text: Which are black by reason of the ice, in which the snow hides itself.

name: Job 6:17
text: In the dry season, they vanish. When it is hot, they are consumed out of their place.

name: Job 6:18
text: The caravans that travel beside them turn aside. They go up into the waste, and perish.

name: Job 6:19
text: The caravans of Tema looked. The companies of Sheba waited for them.

name: Job 6:20
text: They were distressed because they were confident. They came there, and were confounded.

name: Job 6:21
text: For now you are nothing. You see a terror, and are afraid.

name: Job 6:22
text: Did I say, "Give to me?" or, "Offer a present for me from your substance?"

name: Job 6:23
text: or, "Deliver me from the adversary"s hand?" or, "Redeem me from the hand of the oppressors?"

name: Job 6:24
text: "Teach me, and I will hold my peace. Cause me to understand wherein I have erred.

name: Job 6:25
text: How forcible are words of uprightness! But your reproof, what does it reprove?

name: Job 6:26
text: Do you intend to reprove words, since the speeches of one who is desperate are as wind?

name: Job 6:27
text: Yes, you would even cast lots for the fatherless, and make merchandise of your friend.

name: Job 6:28
text: Now therefore be pleased to look at me, for surely I shall not lie to your face.

name: Job 6:29
text: Please return. Let there be no injustice. Yes, return again. My cause is righteous.

name: Job 6:30
text: Is there injustice on my tongue? Can"t my taste discern mischievous things?

name: Job 7:1
text: "Isn"t a man forced to labor on earth? Aren"t his days like the days of a hired hand?

name: Job 7:2
text: As a servant who earnestly desires the shadow, as a hireling who looks for his wages,

name: Job 7:3
text: so am I made to possess months of misery, wearisome nights are appointed to me.
